oxymyrsine: <entryFree id="n33258" type="greek" key="oxy^myrsi_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oxymyrsīnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)cumursinh</foreign>, <sense id="n33258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant prickly-myrtle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">butcher's-broom</hi> (pure Lat. ruscus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

oxyporus: <entryFree id="n33260" type="greek" key="oxy^po^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oxypŏrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)cupo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n33260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that passes quickly through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrating;</hi> of food, <hi rend="ital">easily digested;</hi> of medicine, <hi rend="ital">that operates quickly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:56" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:256" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 23, 96, § 256</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 8, 36, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:36" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oxyrrhoe: <entryFree id="n33261" type="hapax" key="Oxyrrho^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oxyrrhŏē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oxyraē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ocurro/h</foreign>, <sense id="n33261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of Actœon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oxys: <entryFree id="n33262" type="greek" key="oxys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oxys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)cu/s</foreign> (sharp). <sense id="n33262.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Common wood-sorrel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 89, § 112</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33262.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sharp rush</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

Afer. 7, 1.</sense></entryFree>
oxyschoenos: <entryFree id="n33264" type="greek" key="oxyschoenos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oxyschoenos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)cu/sxoinos</foreign>, <sense id="n33264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of rush</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oxytonon: <entryFree id="n33265" type="greek" key="oxy^to^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oxytŏnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)cu/tonon</foreign>, <sense id="n33265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild poppy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oxytriphyllon: <entryFree id="n33266" type="greek" key="oxy^tri^phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oxytrĭphyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)cutri/fullon</foreign>, <sense id="n33266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sharp-leaved trefoil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 30, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oxyzomus: <entryFree id="n33267" type="main" key="oxyzo_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oxyzōmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)cu/zwmos</foreign>, <sense id="n33267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seasoned with sour sauce</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ozaena: <entryFree id="n33268" type="greek" key="ozaena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ozaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/zaina</foreign>. <sense id="n33268.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of polypus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ozaena, dicta a gravi capitis odore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33268.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A polypus in the nose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narium ozaenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 104, § 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ozaenitis: <entryFree id="n33269" type="greek" key="ozaeni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ozaenītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)zaini=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n33269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bastard nard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ozaenosus: <entryFree id="n33270" type="main" key="ozaeno_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ozaenōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ozaena, II.</etym>, <sense id="n33270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">affected with a polypus</hi> of the nose (late Lat.): loca, Pelag. Vet. 16.</sense></entryFree>
ozogardana: <entryFree id="n33271" type="main" key="Ozogardana"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ozogardana</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Mesopotamia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ozomene: <entryFree id="n33272" type="main" key="Ozo^me^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ozŏmĕnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Thaumas and mother of the Harpies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ozymum: <entryFree id="n33273" type="main" key="ozy^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ozymum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. ocinum. <cb n="P." /></entryFree>
p: <entryFree id="n33274" type="main" key="P"><orth extent="full" lang="la">P</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">p</orth>, <itype>the fifteenth letter of the Latin alphabet, the character for which is derived from the ancient form of the Greek II</itype> (P or P), as is shown by inscriptions and coins, which exhibit the <sense id="n33274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P</hi> in these forms.The <hi rend="ital">P</hi>-sound, like the <hi rend="ital">K</hi>- and <hi rend="ital">T</hi>-sounds, was not aspirated in the ancient language; whence the spelling TRIVMPE for triumphe, in the Song of the Arval Brothers.As an initial, <hi rend="ital">P</hi> combines, in pure Latin words, only with the consonants <hi rend="ital">l</hi> and <hi rend="ital">r;</hi> the combinations <hi rend="ital">pn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ps</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">pt</hi> belong to words borrowed from the Greek, with the sole exception of the pron. suffix <hi rend="ital">pte.</hi>— Hence it often disappears before <hi rend="ital">t;</hi> as TOLOMEA, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 9, 438</bibl>.—It has also been dropped before <hi rend="ital">l</hi> in the words lanx, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">plac</foreign>; latus, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">platu/s</foreign>; later, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pli/nqos</foreign>, linter, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">plunth/r</foreign>, and others (Corss. Ausspr. 1, 114).—As a medial, its combination with <hi rend="ital">s</hi> and <hi rend="ital">t</hi> was so acceptable to the Latins that <hi rend="ital">ps</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pt</hi> are often put for <hi rend="ital">bs</hi> and <hi rend="ital">bt;</hi> so, OPSIDESQVE and OPTENVI in the Epitaphs of the Scipios; and so, too, in later inscrr.: APSENS, APSENTI, SVPSIGNARE, etc., and in MSS.—A final <hi rend="ital">p</hi> occurs only in the apocopated volup.For the very frequent interchange of <hi rend="ital">p</hi> and <hi rend="ital">b</hi>, see under B.—<hi rend="ital">P</hi> is put for <hi rend="ital">v</hi> in opilio for ovilio, from ovis.—An instance of its commutation with palatals appears in lupus and <foreign lang="greek">lu/kos</foreign>, and perhaps also spolium and <foreign lang="greek">sku=lon</foreign>, spuma and O.H.G. scum, Germ. Schaum, as, on the other hand, equus and <foreign lang="greek">i(/ppos</foreign>, palumba and columba, jecur and <foreign lang="greek">h(=par</foreign>; cf., also, the letter Q.—Its commutation with a lingual is shown in pavo and <foreign lang="greek">taw/s</foreign>, and perh. also in hospes and hostis. —<hi rend="ital">P</hi> is assimilated to a following <hi rend="ital">f</hi> in officina<cb n="PABU" />  for opificina, and is altogether elided by syncope in Oscus for Opscus.—It is euphonically inserted between <hi rend="ital">ms</hi> and <hi rend="ital">mt</hi>: sumpsi, sumptum, hiemps for hiems; cf.: exemplum, templum, and late Lat. dampnum.—It is suppressed in amnis for ap-nis from apa = aqua.As an abbreviation, <hi rend="ital">P</hi> denotes most frequently the prænomen Publius, but also stands for parte, pater, pedes, pia, pondo, populus, posuerunt, publicus, etc. P. C. stands for patres conscripti, patronus civitatis or coloniae, ponendum curavit, potestate censoriā, etc. P. M. pontifex maximus, patronus municipii, posuit merito. P. P. pater patriae, praepositus, primi pilus, pro parte. P. R. populus Romanus. P. S. pecunia sua.</sense></entryFree>
pa: <entryFree id="n33275" type="main" key="Pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pa</orth> <itype>pro parte</itype> (leg. patre) et po pro potissimum positum est in Saliari carmine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
pabillus: <entryFree id="n33276" type="main" key="pa^billus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păbillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pabo</etym>, <sense id="n33276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small wheelbarrow</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pabo: <entryFree id="n33277" type="gloss" key="pa^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a one-wheeled vehicle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wheelbarrow</hi>: pabo vehiculum unius rotae, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
pabularis: <entryFree id="n33278" type="main" key="pa_bu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pābŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pabulum</etym>, <sense id="n33278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fit for fodder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 41, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pabularius: <entryFree id="n33279" type="gloss" key="pa_bu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pābŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fodder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pasture</hi>: PABVLARIORVM COLLEGIVM, perh. <hi rend="ital">the farmers of the public pastures</hi>, Inscr. Don. cl. 9, n. 3 and 20.</sense></entryFree>
pabulatio: <entryFree id="n33280" type="main" key="pa_bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pābŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pabulor</etym>, <sense id="n33280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pasture.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33280.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n33280.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in milit. language, <hi rend="ital">a collecting of fodder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a foraging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes nostras pabulationes frumentationesque observabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">premi pabulatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulatione intercludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:7" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:11" default="NO">11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pabulator: <entryFree id="n33281" type="main" key="pa_bu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pābŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n33281.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fodderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a herdsman;</hi> only according to the gloss: pabulator pastor, qui bubus pabula praebet, Isid. Gloss.—</sense><sense id="n33281.1" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a forager</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:11" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pabulatorius: <entryFree id="n33282" type="main" key="pa_bu^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pābŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pabulator</etym>, <sense id="n33282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for fodder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:99" default="NO">11, 2, 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pabulor: <entryFree id="n33283" type="main" key="pa_bu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pābŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n33283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [pabulum]. </sense><sense id="n33283.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33283.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To eat fodder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graze</hi> (syn. pascor): <cit><quote lang="la">capella placide et lente pabulatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:6" default="NO">8, 15, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulantia jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=2203" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 2203</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n33283.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To seek fodder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek for food;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to seek a subsistence;</hi> of fishermen: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mare huc prodimus pabulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33283.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to forage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustius pabulantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Caesar pabulandi causā tres legiones misisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulantes nostros profligant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n33283.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to nourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimo pabulandae sunt oleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pabulosus: <entryFree id="n33284" type="main" key="pa_bu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pābŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in fodder</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">insula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pabulum: <entryFree id="n33285" type="main" key="pa_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from the root pa, whence also pa-sco</etym>, <sense id="n33285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourishment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33285.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33285.2" n="A" level="2"> Of men (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dura mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:944" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 944</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira (of the human food of Polyphemus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:105" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:566" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 566</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33285.3" n="B" level="2"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fodder</hi> (very freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bubus pabulum parare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 54, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulo pecoris student (Numidae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secare pabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supportare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquirere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:10" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirundo Pabula parva legens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula decerpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:943" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 943</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula carpsit ovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:750" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 750</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere feris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 685</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:991" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 991</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 364</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:875" default="NO" valid="yes">875</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna feras ducit ad pabula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viciam conserere in pabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:71" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi noctu procedunt ad pabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subus serpentes in pabulo sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 53, 115, § 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager frugum pabulique laetus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>food for men and beasts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 91</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 90, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33285.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustenance</hi> (class.): Acheruntis pabulum, <hi rend="ital">food for Acheron</hi> (said of one who deserves to die), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscibus in alto credo praehibent pabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1063" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1063</bibl></cit>: est <pb n="1287" /> <cb n="PACI" /> enim animorum ingeniorumque naturale quoddam quasi pabulum consideratio contemplatioque naturae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studii atque doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dederatque gravi nova pabula morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:876" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 876</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">manure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula fesso praebere novali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:84" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:5:1" default="NO">2, 5, 1</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">nourishment for the mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi pabula quaedam animo ad sublimiora scandendi conquirens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pac: <entryFree id="n33286" type="main" key="pac"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pac-</orth>, v. pag-.</entryFree>
pacalis: <entryFree id="n33287" type="main" key="pa_ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pax</etym>, <sense id="n33287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to peace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">olea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <trans><tr>peaceful</tr>, <tr>that betokens peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:591" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <trans><tr>on the altar of the goddess of peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:719" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 719</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pacate: <entryFree id="n33288" type="main" key="pa_ca_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. paco, <sense id="n33288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pacatio: <entryFree id="n33289" type="main" key="pa_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. paco</etym>, <sense id="n33289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peace-making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peace</hi>, Front. Strat. praef.</sense></entryFree>
pacator: <entryFree id="n33290" type="main" key="pa_ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peace-maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacificator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjugator</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:15:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:13:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1990" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 1990</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae Iberae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:246" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:483" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rheni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: orbis, Num. ap. Eckh. D. N. 7, p. 190.</sense></entryFree>
pacatorius: <entryFree id="n33291" type="main" key="pa_ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pacator</etym>, <sense id="n33291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">peace-promoting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacific</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pacatula: <entryFree id="n33292" type="main" key="Pa_ca_tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pācātŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pacata</etym>, <sense id="n33292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female proper name</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 128</bibl>, n. 4.</sense></entryFree>
pacatum: <entryFree id="n33293" type="main" key="pa_ca_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. pacatus, under 2. paco.</entryFree>
pacatus: <entryFree id="n33294" type="main" key="pa_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 2. paco.</entryFree>
paccius: <entryFree id="n33295" type="main" key="pacci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paccĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poet mentioned by</hi> Juvenal, 7, 12.</sense></entryFree>
pacensis: <entryFree id="n33296" type="main" key="Pa_censis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pācensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Pax Julia</etym>. <sense id="n33296.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of</hi> Pax Julia (in Lusitania), the modern <hi rend="ital">Beja;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pā-censes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of that city.</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 199, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33296.1" n="II" level="1"> Pacensis colonia, <hi rend="ital">the city of</hi> Forum Julii, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Frejus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33296.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The colony of</hi> Deultum, <hi rend="ital">in Thrace</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Derkon</hi>, Num. ap. Mionnet. Descr. des Medaill. 1, p. 383.</sense></entryFree>
pachynum: <entryFree id="n33297" type="main" key="Pa^chy_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păchȳnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păchȳnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype> (Păchynus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 645</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 482</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/xunos</foreign>, <sense id="n33297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the south-eastern promontory of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looking towards Greece</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Capo Passaro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius promuntorium Pelorus vocatur vergens in Italiam, Pachynum in Graeciam, Lilybaeum in Africam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis Pachynum appulsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metas lustrare Pachyni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 429</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 289</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obversa Pachynos ad austros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 725</bibl></cit>; <case>voc.</case> Pachyne, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:351" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 351</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pacida: <entryFree id="n33298" type="main" key="Pa_ci^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pācĭda</orth>, v. Pagidas, II.</entryFree>
pacidianus: <entryFree id="n33299" type="main" key="Pa_ci^di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pācĭdĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous gladiator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose combat with Æserninus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Samnite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mentioned by Lucilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">became proverbial</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 393, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 97</bibl> (al. Placidianus).</sense></entryFree>
pacifer: <entryFree id="n33300" type="main" key="pa_ci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācĭfer</orth>, <itype>fēra, fŏrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pax-fero</etym>, <sense id="n33300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">peace-bringing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that makes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">announces peace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacific</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 133</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: virga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:139" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 139</bibl></cit>.—A frequent epithet of the gods; <cit><quote lang="la">of Mercury: Cyllenius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 291</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1411</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Jupiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Mars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1353</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Apollo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 38, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Hercules,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1013, 4</bibl>; of Minerva, Inscr. Rein. cl. 1, 228; <cit><quote lang="la">of Genius (perh. of Mercury),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pacifero: <entryFree id="n33301" type="gloss" key="pa_ci^fe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācĭfĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to keep peace</hi>: pacifero, <foreign lang="greek">ei)rh/nhn a)/gw</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
pacificatio: <entryFree id="n33302" type="main" key="pa_ci^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pacifico</etym>, <sense id="n33302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peacemaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacification</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">spes pacificationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opem et gratiam alicujus ad pacificationem quaerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 27, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ista pacificatio perpetrari nequivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pacificator: <entryFree id="n33303" type="main" key="pa_ci^fi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācĭfĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peacemaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacificator</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pacator): Allobrogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Servius pacificator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:119" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Karthaginiensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pacificatorius: <entryFree id="n33304" type="hapax" key="pa_ci^fi^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācĭfĭcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pacificator</etym>, <sense id="n33304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">peace-making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacificatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 1, 3</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PACI" /></sense></entryFree>
pacifice: <entryFree id="n33305" type="main" key="pa_ci^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācĭfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pacificus <sense id="n33305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pacifico: <entryFree id="n33306" type="main" key="pa_ci^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (ante- and post-class.; also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pācĭfĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype>, <sense id="n33306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep.;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>, and cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl> P.) [paxfacio], <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conclude a peace</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n33306.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo Metellus initio, Jugurthā pacificante, praesidium imposuerat,</quote> <trans><tr>at the beginning of Jugurtha's negotiations for peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati pacificatum venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 1, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33306.2" n="(b)" level="5"> As a deponent: <cit><quote lang="la">pacificari cum altero statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacificatus cum Carthaginiensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: set satine tecum pacificatus sum, Antipho? <hi rend="ital">have I quite made my peace with you?</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">are you entirely reconciled?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33306.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to pacify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appease</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">caelestes pacificasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:423" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem suam,</quote> <trans><tr>to soothe</tr>, <tr>quiet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 224" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures Pieriis modis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. 20.</sense></entryFree>
pacificus: <entryFree id="n33307" type="main" key="pa_ci^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pācĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">peacemaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacific</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceable</hi> (class.): persona, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secures,</quote> <trans><tr>the axes in the fasces of the lictors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Janus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:66" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 66</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">beati pacifici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">victimae pacificae,</quote> <trans><tr>peaceofferings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:29:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 29, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32, 6</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pācĭfĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">peace-offerings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtulit pacifica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 6, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pācĭ-fĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pacifically</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceably</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">consulere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 26, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pacio: <entryFree id="n33308" type="gloss" key="pa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păcĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi> (ante-class. for pactio): <cit><quote lang="la">pacionem antiqui dicebant, quam nunc pactionem dicimus: unde et pacisci adhuc et paco in usu remanet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl></cit> Müll. (perh. too, ap. Fest. s. v. nuptias, p. 170, instead of ratio we should read pacio, acc. to the conject. of Dac. on the preced. passage).</sense></entryFree>
pacisco: <entryFree id="n33309" type="main" key="pa^cisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păcisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n33309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [collat. form of <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> paciscor, q. v.], <hi rend="ital">to agree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bargain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi> (class. only in <hi rend="ital">perf. part. pass.</hi>): id quoque paciscunt, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paciscit, obsides ut reddant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">agreed upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenanted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulated</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n33309.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pactum pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoste pactae induciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam pacto inter se ut victorem res sequeretur, ferro decreverunt,</quote> <trans><tr>by agreement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 21, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:97" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33309.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">betrothed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tibi pacta'st Callicli filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus filio pacta est Artavasdis filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii pacta puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnus, cui pacta Lavinia fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 722</bibl></cit>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33309.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pacta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a betrothed woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gremiis abducere pactas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta ejus, Menelai filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:200" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 200</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33309.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pactus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a betrothed husband</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a man engaged</hi> or <hi rend="ital">promised in marriage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles Amissum didicere patrem, Marpissaque pactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:172" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33309.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pactum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pact</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conventio, pactio, obligatio): pactum est, quod inter aliquos convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta et promissa semperne servanda sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansit in condicione atque pacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacti et conventi formula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 18, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex pacto et convento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta conventaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare pacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactum violans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,047:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Mal. 2, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">the covenant of God</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dereliquerunt pactum Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 29, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Reg. 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 6, 14</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a marriagecontract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:401" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 401</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33309.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <case>abl.</case> pacto (like ratione and modo), <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">means</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">percontat Aeneas, quo pacto Troiam urbem liquerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Bell. Pun. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Bell. Pun. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non fecero ei male aliquo pacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quo pacto semper hoc fit,</quote> <trans><tr>how</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 21, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tacebo umquam alio pacto, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo pacto verba his dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo pacto tacito est opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: si nullo alio <cb n="PACO" /> pacto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio pacto docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:21:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 21, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fieri nullo pacto potest, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi mei si me isto pacto metuerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc pacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 248</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paciscor: <entryFree id="n33310" type="main" key="pa^ciscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păciscor</orth>, <itype>pactus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n33310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>) [1. paco], <hi rend="ital">to make a bargain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi> with any one; <hi rend="ital">to covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bargain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi> respecting any thing (cf.: transigo, stipulor, pango). </sense><sense id="n33310.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33310.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n33310.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacisci cum illo paululā pecuniā potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 702</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paciscitur magnā mercede cum Celtiberorum principibus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pacti sunt inter se, ut die statutā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:7" default="NO">16, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:3:5" default="NO">38, 3, 5</bibl>; cf. esp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">votis pacisci, Ne Cypriae Tyriaeque merces Addant avaro divitias mari (= votis transigere cum dis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de mercedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33310.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae pacisci modo scis, set quod pacta's, non scis solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> arg. 1, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (provinciam) sibi pactus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:25:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 25, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam cum aliquo, Auct. B. Alex. 55: omnibus proscriptis, reditum salutemque pactus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:77:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 77, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 26, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pactus in singulos (homines) minas decem a tyranno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Xerxe nuptias filiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 14</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leucippo fieri pactus uterque gener,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:702" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimitti (eum) pactus, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 18</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut firma fierent paciscenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 12, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33310.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of a marriage-contract, <hi rend="ital">to betroth</hi> a woman (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">despondeo, spondeo): ex quā pactus esset vir domo, in matrimonium duceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etutam pacto fratri eum invidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 30, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33310.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to barter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hazard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stake</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vitam pro laude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">letum pro laude,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum pro luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:317" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 317</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paco: <entryFree id="n33311" type="gloss" key="pa^co1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, prim. of paciscor and pango, <sense id="n33311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come to an agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to agree together</hi> respecting any thing: NI CVM EO PACIT TALIO ESTO, Lex XII. Tab.; cf. Dirks, Uebers. p. 516 sq.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33312" type="main" key="pa_co2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāco</orth>, <itype>ăvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pax</etym>, <sense id="n33312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring into a state of peace and quietness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make peaceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothe</hi> (class.; cf.: pacifico, placo). </sense><sense id="n33312.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacare Amanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem Galliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nuper pacati erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispanias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bimarem Isthmon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 26" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:7:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erymanthi nemora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 803</bibl></cit>: MARE A PRAEDONIBVS, Monum. Ancyr. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> ap. Grut. 233; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33312.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things as objects: <cit><quote lang="la">incultae pacantur vomere silvae,</quote> <trans><tr>are subdued</tr>, <tr>tilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pacare metu silvas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus remotos pacabat cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:250" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertos animi aestus,</quote> <trans><tr>to quiet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Honor. 225</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">feras,</quote> <trans><tr>to tame</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idyll. 6, 100</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pācā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pacified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quieted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisturbed</hi> (opp. hostilis; class.). </sense><sense id="n33312.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacatae tranquillaeque civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in provinciā pacatissimā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacatissima et quietissima pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec hospitale quicquam pacatumve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacato agmine transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacati status aëris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacata posse omnia mente tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacatus mitisque adsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 141</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pācātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a friendly country</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagi milites in pacato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex pacatis praedas agere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from countries at peace with Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui medius inter pacata et hostilia fuit, Danubius et Rhenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33312.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio pacatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ne pacatam quidem nequitiam quisquam ferre posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>.—And in the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec diu in pacato mansit gens,</quote> <trans><tr>on friendly terms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 27, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pācātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">peaceably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quietly</hi> (post-Aug.).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacatius ad reliqua secessimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 111" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 111</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacatissime et commodissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Soliloq. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Soliloq. 2, 7</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1288" /> <cb n="PACU" /></sense></entryFree>
paconius: <entryFree id="n33313" type="main" key="Paco_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pacōnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So M. Paconius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">another M. Paconius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pacorus: <entryFree id="n33314" type="main" key="Pa^co^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păcŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n33314.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Orodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Parthia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the conqueror of Crassus; he was afterwards conquered by Ventidius Bassus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the legate of Antony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16" default="NO">16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33314.1" n="II" level="1"> Pacorus II., <hi rend="ital">a king of the Parthians in the time of Domitian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:36:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 36, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33314.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 39, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">102, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pacta: <entryFree id="n33315" type="main" key="pacta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pacta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. pactus, under pacisco <sense id="n33315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
pacticius: <entryFree id="n33316" type="hapax" key="pacti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pactīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paciscor</etym>, <sense id="n33316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agreed upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:25:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 25, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pactilis: <entryFree id="n33317" type="hapax" key="pacti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pactĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pango</etym>, <sense id="n33317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plaited together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wreathed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 8, § 11</bibl></cit> (opp. sutilis).</sense></entryFree>
pactio: <entryFree id="n33318" type="main" key="pacti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>paciscor</etym>. <sense id="n33318.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an agreeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenanting; an agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bargain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pact</hi> (syn. pactum): <cit><quote lang="la">est autem pactio duorum plurinmve in idem placitum et consensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pactionibus faciendis legem spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactionem facere de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 34</bibl></cit>, and 14, 40: <cit><quote lang="la">nefarias cum multis pactiones conflare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 20, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactionem cum aliquo facere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones pactionesque bellicas perturbare perjurio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 18, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma per pactionem tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā fide in pactione manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,017:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ag. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus pactionibus pacem facere,</quote> <trans><tr>conditions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dion. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpositā pactione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2:3" default="NO">22, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactionem de republicā facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 35, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegam suum Antonium pactione provinciae perpulerat, ne, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>by making over to him his province according to agreement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactionem nuptialem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a promise</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. in Sen. 13, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33318.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33318.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the farmers general and the inhabitants of a province</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactiones cum aliquo conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:65:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 65, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33318.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A corrupt bargaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an underhand agreement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">compact</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullos pactionis suspicionem non vitasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:7:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 7, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aulum spe pactionis perpulit, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 26, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33318.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A truce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut pax aut pactio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:24" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33318.5" n="D" level="2"> Pactio verborum, <hi rend="ital">a form of words</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex pactione verborum, quibus jusjurandum comprehenditur,</quote> <trans><tr>on account of the form of oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos cum pactionibus adorare et formulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n33318.6" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A marriage-contract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic eam rem volt, scio, mecum adire ad pactionem (= mecum pacisci),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pactitius: <entryFree id="n33319" type="main" key="pacti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pactītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. pacticius.</entryFree>
pactiuncula: <entryFree id="n33320" type="gloss" key="pacti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pactĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pactio</etym>, <sense id="n33320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an agreement</hi>: pactio, pactiuncula, Not. Tir.</sense></entryFree>
pactolus: <entryFree id="n33321" type="main" key="Pacto_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pactōlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paktwlo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Lydia which was said to bring down golden sands</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Sarabat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 191" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 142</bibl>: Pactolus aureas undas agens, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 243, 20</bibl>.—Prov., of wealth: <cit><quote lang="la">tibique Pactolus fluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:299" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 299</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n33321.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pactōlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Pactolus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nymphae Pactolides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pactor: <entryFree id="n33322" type="hapax" key="pactor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pactor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>paciscor</etym>, <sense id="n33322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes a contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contractor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negotiator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatis pactores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pactum: <entryFree id="n33323" type="main" key="pactum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pactum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. pacisco <sense id="n33323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pactumejus: <entryFree id="n33324" type="main" key="Pactu^me_jus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pactŭmējus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a supposititious son of Canidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:50" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pactus: <entryFree id="n33325" type="main" key="pactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pacisco.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n33326" type="main" key="pactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pango.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33327" type="main" key="pactus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pactus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. pacisco <sense id="n33327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pactye: <entryFree id="n33328" type="main" key="Pacty^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pactyē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pactya</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paktu/h</foreign>, <sense id="n33328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thrace</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Doghan Arslan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pacuvius: <entryFree id="n33329" type="main" key="Pa_cu^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pācŭvĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pācŭus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So esp. Pacuvius, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated Roman poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Brundisium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nephew of Ennius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and contemporary of P. Scipio Africanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:229" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 64, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 11, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 97</bibl>. He is also said to have distinguished himself as a painter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 7, § 19</bibl>.—Sync. form: <cb n="PAED" /> Pacui discipulus dicor, porro is fuit Enni, Enniu' musarum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 88, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 7, § 19</bibl> Jan.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33329.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pā-cŭvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pacuvian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">physicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudo,</quote> <trans><tr>described by Pacuvius</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus est Pacuvianum illud: nam si qui, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>that Pacuvian verse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:34" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
