padaei: <entryFree id="n33330" type="main" key="Pa^daei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pădaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of farther India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the mouth of the Indus.</hi> Acc. to Herodotus (3,99) they were cannibals.— <hi rend="ital">Sing. collect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinus Phoebo tenet arva Padaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:15:1:145" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 15, 1, 145</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
padaneus: <entryFree id="n33331" type="main" key="Pa^dane^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pădanĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Padus, A.</entryFree>
padanus: <entryFree id="n33332" type="main" key="Pa^da_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pădānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Padus, B.</entryFree>
padi: <entryFree id="n33333" type="foreign" key="pa^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pădi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gallic</etym>, <sense id="n33333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pitch-pines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
padus: <entryFree id="n33334" type="main" key="Pa^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pădus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Po</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the principal river of Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive Padi ripis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populiferque Padus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 17, 32</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n33334.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pădānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on the Po</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33334.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pădā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Po</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
padusa: <entryFree id="n33335" type="main" key="Pa^du_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pădūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a canal running from the Po to Ravenna</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">canal of St. Alberti</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscosove amne Padusae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 457</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paean: <entryFree id="n33336" type="main" key="Paean"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paean</orth>, <itype>ānis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paia/n</foreign>. <sense id="n33336.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An appellation of Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the healing deity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum Paeanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paeana voca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 720</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:172" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 172</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33336.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33336.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A religious hymn</hi>, orig. in honor of Apollo, but also transf. to other deities, <hi rend="ital">a festive hymn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hymn of triumph</hi> or <hi rend="ital">praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclamant socii laetum paeana secuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 738</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 657</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculeum paeana canunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:157" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paeanem citare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl></cit>.—As a simple exclamation, like hymenaee: <cit><quote lang="la">dicite io Paean, et io bis dicite Paean,</quote> <trans><tr>shout huzza!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33336.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The prevailing foot in the versification of such hymns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of one long syllable and three short ones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:215" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 215</bibl> and 218 (commonly written paeon, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
paeanitis: <entryFree id="n33337" type="main" key="Paea_ni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeānītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">paeānītes</orth>, <case>acc.</case> em or <itype>en</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, now unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 180</bibl>.—Form in -tes, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 440</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 14, 4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paeantiades: <entryFree id="n33338" type="main" key="Paeanti^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeantĭădes, Paeantĭus, Pae-as</orth>, v. Poeant-.</entryFree>
paeantis: <entryFree id="n33339" type="main" key="paeantis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paeantis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 14, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paedagoga: <entryFree id="n33340" type="main" key="paeda^go_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedăgōga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>paedagogus</etym>, <sense id="n33340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a governess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 128</bibl>, n. 4.</sense></entryFree>
paedagogatus: <entryFree id="n33341" type="main" key="paeda^go_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedăgōgātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">education</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruction</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paedagogianus: <entryFree id="n33342" type="main" key="paeda^go_gi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedăgōgĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paedagogium</etym>, <sense id="n33342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> paedagogium (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">29, 3, 3</bibl>: qui ministeriales et paedagogiani exsistunt, <hi rend="ital">reared to serve at court</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 7, 5.</sense></entryFree>
paedagogium: <entryFree id="n33343" type="greek" key="paeda^go_gi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedăgōgīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paidagwgei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n33343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place where boys of servile birth intended for pages were educated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the pages' hall</hi> (not ante-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33343.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33343.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the boys in a</hi> paedagogium: <cit><quote lang="la">paedagogium pretiosā veste succingitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 17:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 123, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33343.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">boys reared for vice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenuae conditionis paedagogia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paedagogo: <entryFree id="n33344" type="main" key="paeda^go_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedăgōgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>paedagogus</etym>, <sense id="n33344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to educate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruct</hi> (ante- and post-class.): depulsum mammā paedagogandum accipit, Pac. ap. Fest. s. v. repotia, p. 281 Müll.; Fulg. Planc. Contin. Virg. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
paedagogus: <entryFree id="n33345" type="greek" key="paeda^go_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedăgōgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paidagwgo/s</foreign>, lit. <sense id="n33345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slave who took the children to school and had the charge of them at home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a governor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preceptor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pedagogue</hi> (cf. praeceptor). </sense><sense id="n33345.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non paedagogum jam me, sed Ludum vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrices et paedagogi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam quicquam aliud sit sapiens quam humani generis paedagogus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de paedagogis hoc amplius, ut aut sint eruditi plane, aut se non esse eruditos sciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:10" default="NO">1, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:25" default="NO">25</bibl>; 1, 3, 15; 6, 1, 41 et saep.—Terence jestingly <cb n="PAEL" /> gives the name paedagogus to a young man who accompanied his sweetheart to and from school. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33345.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex paedagoga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 681</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lex paedagogus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 3, 24</bibl></cit>). —</sense><sense id="n33345.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33345.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unicuique nostrum paedagogum dari deum inferioris notae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 50:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33345.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pedant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic dux, hic ille est paedagogus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paederos: <entryFree id="n33346" type="greek" key="paede^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedĕros</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paide/rws</foreign>. <sense id="n33346.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33346.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An opal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 22, § 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33346.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An amethyst</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 123</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33346.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of bear's-foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 34, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paedia: <entryFree id="n33347" type="main" key="Paedi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paedīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paidei/a</foreign> (personified), <sense id="n33347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doctrine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, 728</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 578</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paedicator: <entryFree id="n33348" type="main" key="paedi_ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedīcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. paedico</etym>, <sense id="n33348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one given to unnatural vice</hi>, Licin. Calv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paedico: <entryFree id="n33349" type="main" key="paedi_co1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedīco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pēdīco</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 68</bibl>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">paidiko/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n33349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to practise unnatural vice.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33349.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:94:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 94, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of various forms of unnatural lewdness, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:104:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 104, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 67, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33349.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the tunic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:99:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 99, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33350" type="main" key="paedi_co2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedīco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. paedico</etym>, <sense id="n33350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who practises unnatural vice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:33:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:86:1" default="NO">12, 86, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paedidus: <entryFree id="n33351" type="main" key="paedi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paedor</etym>, <sense id="n33351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>: paedidos sordidos significant atque obsoletos: tractum vocabulum a Graeco, quia <foreign lang="greek">pai=des</foreign>, i. e. pueri, talis sint aetatis, ut nesciant a sordibus abstinere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl> Müll.: senex, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 13</bibl> (al. perditus, al. arthriticus): <cit><quote lang="la">paedidissimi servi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paedor: <entryFree id="n33352" type="main" key="paedor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paedor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root pu-; Sanscr. pūje, to be rotten, stink; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pu/qomai, pu/on</foreign>; cf. pus, puter, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n33352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nastiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi> (syn.: illuvies, sordes). </sense><sense id="n33352.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: barba paedore horrida, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra horrida paedore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 126</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exuere paedorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longus in carcere paedor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 991" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 991</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33352.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stench</hi> (post-class.): sine paedore, Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 24.</sense></entryFree>
paegniarius: <entryFree id="n33353" type="main" key="paegni^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paegnĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paegnium</etym>, <sense id="n33353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to play.</hi> Thus the name paegniarii was given to gladiators who fought only in jest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">APRILIS PAEGNIAR.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2566</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paegnium: <entryFree id="n33354" type="main" key="Paegni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paegnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pai/gnion</foreign> (plaything), <sense id="n33354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman slave-name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paelex: <entryFree id="n33355" type="main" key="paelex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paelex</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pēlex</orth>, <itype>and, only in inscriptions</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pellex</orth>), <itype>icis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>akin to Sanscr. pallavaka, girl; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pallaki/s</foreign>, concubine</etym>, <sense id="n33355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kept mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concubine</hi> of a married man. </sense><sense id="n33355.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: antiqui proprie eam pelicem nominabant, quae uxorem habenti nubebat. Cui generi mulierum etiam poena constituta est a Numā Pompilio hāc lege: paelex aram Junonis ne tangito, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libro Memorialium Masurius scribit: pelicem apud antiquos eam habitam, quae, cum uxor non esset, cum aliquo tamen vivebat eamque nunc vero nomine amicam, paulo honestiore concubinam appellari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:144" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 24</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. of the wronged wife</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiae paelex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70, 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tune eris et matris paelex et adultera patris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Jovis magni paelex, metuenda sorori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugit (Medea) ulta paelicem, Magni Creontis filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:63" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 57</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the cows, as rivals of Pasiphaë, who had become enamoured of a bull, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 321</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33355.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33355.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kept mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concubine</hi>, in gen. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">virginem constupratam servo suo paelicem dederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Artaxerxi regi Persarum ex paelicibus centum et quindecim filii fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: Granius Flaccus scribit, pelicem quosdam vocare eam, quae uxoris loco sine nuptiis in domo sit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:144" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 144</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33355.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A male prostitute</hi> (postclass.), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Dolabella eum (Caesarem) pelicem reginae (appellavit), as the favorite of King Nicomedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in apposition, pelices ministri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:97:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 97, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n33355.5" n="C" level="2"> Comically, <pb n="1289" /> <cb n="PAEN" /> <hi rend="ital">a substitute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties pelex culcita facta mea est (sc. matellae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:119:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 119, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paeligni: <entryFree id="n33356" type="main" key="Paeligni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeligni</orth>, v. Peligni.</entryFree>
paeminosus: <entryFree id="n33357" type="main" key="paemi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paemĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> In econom. lang., <sense id="n33357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of chinks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uneven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">area,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 51</bibl></cit> (cited <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 163, 14</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
paene: <entryFree id="n33358" type="main" key="paene"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paene</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">pēne</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <sense id="n33358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as I may say</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fores paene effregisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem paene perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene communis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brutum non minus amo, quam tu: paene dixi quam te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum in omnibus civitatibus, sed paene etiam in singulis domibus, factiones sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam paene furvae regna Proserpinae ... vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene manu, quod amo, tanta est vicinia, tango: Saepe sed, heu! lacrimas hoc mihi paene movet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 179</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi nostri equites acutius vidissent, paene concedente adversario superasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones duas paene delessent, ni, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—Paene sometimes follows the word it qualifies: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus par paene laus tribuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totidem paene reperiantur genera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta paene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 32, 127</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 55, 209: divini paene est viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:29:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 29, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et crescere paene opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 53, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 7, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 27, 11: nudā paene cathedrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 65</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mea consilia perturbat paenissume (penissime),</quote> <trans><tr>utterly</tr>, <tr>completely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me paenissume perdidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenissime os alicui sublinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 336, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 608</bibl> and 1008 P.</sense></entryFree>
paeninsula: <entryFree id="n33359" type="main" key="paeninsu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paeninsŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pēn-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>paene-insula</etym>, <sense id="n33359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peninsula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paenitendus: <entryFree id="n33360" type="main" key="paeni^tendus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenĭtendus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paenĭtens</orth>, v. paeniteo <sense id="n33360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
paenitentia: <entryFree id="n33361" type="main" key="paeni^tenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenĭtentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>paeniteo</etym>, <sense id="n33361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">repentance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penitence</hi> (not in Cic.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 12, 10</bibl>).—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">celerem paenitentiam sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec poenā commilitonum exterriti, nec paenitentiā conversi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidelissimus est ad honesta ex paenitentiā transitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3</bibl></cit>, praef. 3.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serae dant poenas turpes paenitentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestae rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 19, § 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:67" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 23, 33, § 67</bibl>: paenitentiam agere, <hi rend="ital">to repent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo usque processum est, ut non paeniturum pro non acturo paenitentiam dixerit (Sallustius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (facinoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 6:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:7:10" default="NO">7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
paenitentialis: <entryFree id="n33362" type="main" key="paeni^tenti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenĭtentĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. presbyter) [paenitentia], <sense id="n33362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a priest appointed to hear the confession of penitents; a confessor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 419, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paeniteo: <entryFree id="n33363" type="main" key="paeni^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenĭtĕo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">poen-</orth>), <itype>ui</itype>, no <sense id="n33363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> [root in poena, q. v.; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">poinh/</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n33363.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33363.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to repent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to displease</hi> (anteclass. and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">et me quidem haec conditio nunc non paenitet,</quote> <trans><tr>causes me no regret</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: quod male emptum est semper paenitet, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 5, 6, § 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenitemini et credite Evangelio,</quote> <trans><tr>repent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 3, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33363.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to repent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be sorry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">momenta certaminum assuefaciebant militem minus jam tandem aut virtutis aut fortunae paenitere suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam nunc paenitere suā sponte Aequos quam pati hostilia malle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses primi paenitere coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenituit populus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 48, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vult paenitere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lepidus paenitens consili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">paenitens facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 43 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; cf. II. A. <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">i</foreign> infra.—</sense><sense id="n33363.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33363.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">It repents</hi> one, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">I</hi>, <hi rend="ital">you</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">repent; I</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">repent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">am sorry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rue</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n33363.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem alicujus rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non paenitere me consilii de tuā mansione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ... in eam diem vitae non paenituerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: neque te, neque quenquam arbitror tuae paeniturum laudis, App. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 158, 5</bibl>: galeatum sero duelli paenitet,<cb n="PAEN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:170" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33363.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicujus rei</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae mentis paenituisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N 4</bibl></cit>, praef. 7: <cit><quote lang="la">paenitebatque modo consilii, modo paenitentiae ipsius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:7:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33363.8" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">si eos quidem non paeniteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33363.9" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of person</hi>, foll. by <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficiunt ut me non didicisse minus paeniteat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 77</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (cf. I. B. supra; Zumpt, Gr. § 442, explains the <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> in these passages as <case>acc.</case>, but v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 876): <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis est nihil, quod paenitere possit, facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur ut nihil paeniteat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 18, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeri oportet utrum id facinus sit, quod paenitere fuerit necesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 13, 43</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Foll. by <hi rend="ital">rel. adverb. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi solet eum, cum aliquid fecit, paenitere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde ego ipsi, quod de suā sententiā decesserit, paenitendum puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenitet quod non ab adultero coepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 335" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 335</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">dat. of agent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii nostri ... nobis paenitendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta vis fuit paenitendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 79</bibl></cit>: corrigere errorem paenitendo, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sallustius usque eo processit, ut non paeniturum pro non acturo paenitentiam dixerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenitet et torqueor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 2, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33363.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">It discontents</hi> or <hi rend="ital">displeases one</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one is vexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">angry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissatisfied</hi> (class.; cf. taedet). </sense><sense id="n33363.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem alicujus rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me imperii nostri paeniteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num hujusce te gloriae paenitebat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 13, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num igitur, si ad centesimum annum vixisset, senectutis suae eum paeniteret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenitere se virium suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenituit multos vanae sterilisque cathedrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 203</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33363.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se paenitere, quod animum tuum offenderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33363.13" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">It concerns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is a care to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">makes anxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissatisfies;</hi> and with negative, <hi rend="ital">it is enough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfies</hi> (mostly anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">an paenitet te, quanto hic fuerit usui?</quote> <trans><tr>are you not satisfied?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenitetne te, quot ancillas alam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 52</bibl></cit>: duas dabo, una si parum'st; <cit><quote lang="la">et si duarum paenitebit, addentur duae,</quote> <trans><tr>are not enough</tr>, <tr>not satisfactory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an paenitebat flagitii te auctore quod fecisset Adulescens?</quote> <trans><tr>was it not enough?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an paenitet vos, quod salvum atque incolumem exercitum traduxerim?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod a senatu quanti fiam minime me paenitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tam diu velle debebis (discere), quoad te quantum proficias non paenitebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n33363.14" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">paenĭtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">repenting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repentant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penitent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33363.15" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus est portus paenitenti mutatio consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33363.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: Lepidum paenitentem consilii, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 224</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n33363.17" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa paenitentis de matrimonio dederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 43</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">paenĭtenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with regret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repentantly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">auguria paenitenter omissa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33363.18" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">paenĭ-tendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to be repented of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blamable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">objectionable</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n33363.19" n="1" level="3"> Affirmatively: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque hic ager sive exercetur, seu cessat, colono est paenitendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenitendae rei recordatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33363.20" n="2" level="3"> With a negative: <cit><quote lang="la">sub haud paenitendo magistro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta non paenitenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens Flavia reipublicae non paenitenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paeniteor: <entryFree id="n33364" type="main" key="paeni^te^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenĭtĕor</orth>, <itype>ēri</itype> <etym>collat. form of paeniteo</etym>, <sense id="n33364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to repent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 3, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paenitudo: <entryFree id="n33365" type="main" key="paeni^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>paeniteo</etym>, <sense id="n33365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">repentance</hi> (ante- and post-class. for paenitentia), Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 152, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">169, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Laps. Virg. 8, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paenula: <entryFree id="n33366" type="main" key="paenu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pēn-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woollen outer garment covering the whole body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of cloak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mantle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worn on journeys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and also in the city in rainy weather</hi> (cf.: laena, lacerna): paenulam in caput induce, ne te noscat, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 537, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so Lucil. ib.: paenulā irretitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incolumi Rhodos ... facit quod Paenula solstitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 190</bibl>: non quaerenda est homini, qui habet virtutem, paenula in imbri, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 537, 12</bibl>: et <cb n="PAET" /> multo stillaret paenula nimbo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 79</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Varr. ap. Non. l. l.: paenulis intra Urbem frigoris causā ut senes uterentur, permisit ... matronas tamen intra Urbem paenulis uti vetuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 4, 13</bibl>.—In later times also worn by orators, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 39</bibl>.—Prov.: paenulam alicui scindere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to press one strongly to stay</hi> (opp.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix paenulam alicui attingere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 33, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33366.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 448, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas paenulast tergo tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 75</bibl></cit> Lorenz: <cit><quote lang="la">ne paenula desit olivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra catinum paenula, ut infundibulum inversum, est attemperata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33367" type="main" key="Paenu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paenŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 19, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paenularius: <entryFree id="n33368" type="main" key="paenu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>paenula</etym>, <sense id="n33368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of mantles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mantillas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pœnula-maker</hi>: consequitur paenularium, Novat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 148, 33</bibl> (acc. to Non., paenularium is a <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, having the sense of theca et vagina paenula, <hi rend="ital">a receptacle in which the pœnula is kept</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">CN. COSSVTIVS PAENVLARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 646, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paenulatus: <entryFree id="n33369" type="main" key="paenu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing the pœnula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:28:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:57" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paenuleus: <entryFree id="n33370" type="main" key="paenu^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the pœnula</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pœnulean</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Diadum. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paenultimus: <entryFree id="n33371" type="main" key="paenulti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenultĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pēn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paene-ultimus</etym>, <sense id="n33371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the last but one</hi> (post-class. for proximus a postremo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:217" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 217</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">paenultima meta November,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. Quotae Cal. Sint Mens. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33371.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pae-nultĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. syllaba), <hi rend="ital">the penultimate syllable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the penult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenultimam circumflectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paenuria: <entryFree id="n33372" type="main" key="paenu_ria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paenūria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. penuria.</entryFree>
paeon: <entryFree id="n33373" type="greek" key="paeon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paeon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">paean</orth>, <itype>ānis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:215" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 215</bibl> v. h. v.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paiw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n33373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a metrical foot of four syllables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three short and one long</hi> (and which, acc. to the position of the long syllable, is called primus, secundus, tertius, quartus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:87" default="NO">87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:110" default="NO">110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 477</bibl> P.; Don. p. 1739 ib.; Mar. Vict. p. 1957.</sense></entryFree>
paeones: <entryFree id="n33374" type="main" key="Paeo^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pai/ones</foreign>, <sense id="n33374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in that part of it afterwards called Emathia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pœonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:77" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 313</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeŏn</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pai/wn</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Pœonian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51, 6</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n33374.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paioni/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Pœonians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Emathia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33374.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female Pœonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paeonis Euippe mater fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 303</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33374.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paio/nios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pœonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pœonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paeonia: <entryFree id="n33375" type="greek" key="paeo_ni^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paeōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paiwni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the peony</hi>, so named after its discoverer, Pæon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 10, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n33376" type="main" key="Paeo^ni^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Paeones, A.</entryFree>
paeonicus: <entryFree id="n33377" type="main" key="paeo_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paeōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paeon</etym>, <sense id="n33377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the foot pœon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pœonic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 506</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
paeonis: <entryFree id="n33378" type="main" key="Paeo^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Paeones, B.</entryFree>
paeonius: <entryFree id="n33379" type="main" key="Paeo^ni^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Paeones, C.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33380" type="main" key="Paeo_ni^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paiw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n33380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the god of medicine</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*paiw/n</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">healing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">medicinal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ope Paeoniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:27" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Apon. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Get. 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paestum: <entryFree id="n33381" type="main" key="Paestum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Lucania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly called</hi> Posidonia, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its twice-blowing roses</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pesti</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">biferique rosaria Paesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 119</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 708</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:5:61" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 5, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum Paestum Graecis Posidonia appellatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 71</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33381.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paestānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pœstum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pœstan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:4:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paestāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Pœstans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paetulus: <entryFree id="n33382" type="hapax" key="paetu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paetŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n33382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [paetus], <hi rend="ital">having a slight cast in the eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightly blinkeyed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeo ad deos: ecquos si non tam strabones, at paetulos esse arbitramur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. paetus.</sense></entryFree>
paetus: <entryFree id="n33383" type="main" key="paetus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paetus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <sense id="n33383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having leering eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a cast in the eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blinking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">winking with the eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blinkeyed;</hi> esp. as an epithet of Venus, <hi rend="ital">prettily leering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a pretty cast in her eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prettily<pb n="1290" /> <cb n="PAGI" />  blinking</hi>: paetus, <foreign lang="greek">mu/wy toi=s o)/mmasin</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">uni animalium homini depravantur oculi: unde Strabonum et Paetorum cognomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Plaut. Fragm. ap. Fest. s. v. valgos, p. 375 Müll.: strabonem Appellat paetum pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>.—Of Venus: non haec res de Venere paeta strabam facit? Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 684</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">si paeta est, Veneri similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva flavo lumine est, Venus paeto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33384" type="main" key="Paetus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paetus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33384.1" n="1" level="3"> Q. Aelius Paetus, <hi rend="ital">consul with</hi> M. Junius Pennus, A. U. C. 587.—</sense><sense id="n33384.2" n="2" level="3"> P. Aelius Paetus, <hi rend="ital">an augur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33384.3" n="3" level="3"> L. Papirius Paetus, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 12</bibl>. To him are addressed the letters of Cicero, ad Fam. 9, 15-26.</sense></entryFree>
pagae: <entryFree id="n33385" type="main" key="Pagae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pagae</orth>, <itype>arum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Megaris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pa-gaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people of Pagœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paganalia: <entryFree id="n33386" type="main" key="Pa_ga_na_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāgānālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pagus</etym>, <sense id="n33386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the festival of the</hi> pagus, <hi rend="ital">celebrated in January; the country festival</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rural festival</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 24</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>, § 26 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paganicus: <entryFree id="n33387" type="main" key="pa_ga_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgānĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33387.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">paganicae feriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 26</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Paganalia: IOVI PAGANICO SACR.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1250</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona habere in paganico (sc. solo or agro),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. paganus: pila paganica, <hi rend="ital">a ball stuffed with down</hi>, used at first in the country, but afterwards also in the city, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:32:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 32, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:45:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 45, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker, Gall. 3, p. 94. —</sense><sense id="n33387.2" n="II" level="1"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">heathenish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pagan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paganismus: <entryFree id="n33388" type="main" key="pa_ga_nismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgānismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>paganus</etym>, <sense id="n33388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heathenism</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Divers. Quaest. 83" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Divers. Quaest. 83</bibl>, q. 83 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
paganitas: <entryFree id="n33389" type="main" key="pa_ga_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgānĭtas</orth>, ātis <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heathenism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paganism</hi> (post-class.): stolidae paganitatis error, Cod. Th. 15, 5, 5.</sense></entryFree>
paganus: <entryFree id="n33390" type="main" key="pa_ga_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pagus</etym>. <sense id="n33390.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the country</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to a village</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">PORTICVS, Inscr. (A. U. C. 659) Orell. 3793: lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:670" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 670</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33390.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a countryman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">villager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli pagani aut montani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:28:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 28, 74</bibl></cit>: pagani vel decuriones, Cod. Th. 7, 21, 2.—</sense><sense id="n33390.2" n="II" level="1"> Opposed to military, <hi rend="ital">civil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel paganum est peculium vel castrense,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 28, 37</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a civilian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a citizen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paganorum turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites et pagani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33390.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlearned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 25, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. semipaganus.—</sense><sense id="n33390.4" n="B" level="2"> In eccl. Lat. (like gentilis) for <hi rend="ital">heathen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pagan</hi> (opp. Jewish or Christian); and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a heathen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pagan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus cultusque, Cod. Th. 16, 7, 2: sacerdotales paganae superstitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 16, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Cor. Mil. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum falsorum multorumque cultores paganos vocamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 2:43" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex locorum agrestium compitis et pagis pagani vocantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pagasa: <entryFree id="n33391" type="main" key="Pa^ga^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păgăsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păgăsae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pagasai/</foreign>, <sense id="n33391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime town of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards called</hi> Demetrias, <hi rend="ital">where the Argo was built</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Pagasam amplexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 17</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:451" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 451</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33391.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pă-găsaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pagasa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pagasœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:401" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <trans><tr>the Argo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jason,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:349" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux Pagasaea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Alcestis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33391.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păgăsēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pagasœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <trans><tr>the Argo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:422" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 422</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33391.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păgăsĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pagasœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 23, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pagatim: <entryFree id="n33392" type="main" key="pa_ga_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>pagus</etym>, <sense id="n33392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by districts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">villages</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in every village</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa pagatim sacrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:30" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pageiei: <entryFree id="n33393" type="gloss" key="pa_geiei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgeiei</orth>, v. pagus <sense id="n33393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pagella: <entryFree id="n33394" type="main" key="pa_gella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pagina</etym>, <sense id="n33394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little page</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:36:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 36, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pages: <entryFree id="n33395" type="gloss" key="pa_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāges</orth>, <itype>compactio, unde compages et propagare</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 64</bibl>. 28.</entryFree>
pagidas: <entryFree id="n33396" type="main" key="Pagi^das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pagĭdas</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pagĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n33396.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Africa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33396.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Phœnicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Mount Carmel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called Belus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 19, 17, § 75</bibl> (Jahn, Pacida). <cb n="PALA" /></sense></entryFree>
pagina: <entryFree id="n33397" type="main" key="pa_gi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root pag-(pak-), of pango, <foreign lang="greek">ph/gnumi</foreign>; v. pagus</etym>, <sense id="n33397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a written page</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leaf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paginae dictae, quod ... in illis versus panguntur, id est figuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl></cit> Müll. </sense><sense id="n33397.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hanc paginam tenerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complere paginam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantas paginas commovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:19:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 19, 53</bibl></cit>;
