<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 24, § 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">censoriarum legum paginae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">millesima pagina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 100</bibl></cit>.— Prov.: fortuna paginam utramque facit, <hi rend="ital">fills both sides of the account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confers both good and ill fortune</hi> (alluding to accountbooks, in which the receipts were written on one page and the expenses on the opposite one), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33397.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33397.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A page</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">any writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a letter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">book</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">varie sum affectus tuis litteris: valde priore paginā perturbatus, paulum alterā recreatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondi postremae tuae paginae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lasciva est nobis pagina, vita proba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 2, 301</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33397.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A leaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel tabellas qualescumque marmoreas aut paginas imprimemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 6, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignis honorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a plate on which are engraved a person's titles and honors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33397.5" n="C" level="2"> In vine-dressers' lang., <hi rend="ital">four rows of vines joined together in a square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quarter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paginalis: <entryFree id="n33398" type="main" key="pa_gi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pagina</etym>, <sense id="n33398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a page</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pager-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stili cura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commercium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paginatus: <entryFree id="n33399" type="main" key="pa_gi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joined together</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 353</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paginula: <entryFree id="n33400" type="main" key="pa_gi^nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgĭnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little page</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pagmentum: <entryFree id="n33401" type="main" key="pagmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pagmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pago</etym>, <sense id="n33401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is joined together</hi> (compactio, res compacta): <cit><quote lang="la">qui sunt ante secundum pagmentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. secundum antepagmentum).</sense></entryFree>
pago: <entryFree id="n33402" type="gloss" key="pago"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pago</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. pango <sense id="n33402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pagrus: <entryFree id="n33403" type="greek" key="pagrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pagrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">phagr-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">păger</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ph-</orth>), <itype>ri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/gros</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">fa/gros</foreign>), <sense id="n33403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish</hi>, otherwise unknown: <cit><quote lang="la">pagrus fluviatilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 38, § 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 16, 2, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pagur: <entryFree id="n33404" type="main" key="pa^gur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păgur</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish</hi>, otherwise unknown (perh. = preced.): <cit><quote lang="la">rutilus pagur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:107" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pagurus: <entryFree id="n33405" type="greek" key="pa^gu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păgūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/gouros</foreign>, <sense id="n33405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of crab-fish</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">a punger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pagus: <entryFree id="n33406" type="main" key="pa_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (old <sense id="n33406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> PAGEIEI, which prob. is an error for PAGEI, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3793</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root pak-, pag-, to make fast or firm, whence pango, pax, pagina; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ph/gnumi, pa/gos</foreign>, etc.; prop., a place with fixed boundaries; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">province</hi> (opp. to the city), <hi rend="ital">the country</hi> (cf. vicus): <cit><quote lang="la">paganalia (feriae sunt eorum) qui sunt aliquoius pagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 26 Müll.: Lemonia tribus a pago Lemonio appellata est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pagos et compita circum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omissis pagis vicisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">MAGISTER PAGI,</quote> <trans><tr>a country magistrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3793 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me toto laudet vicinia pago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 154</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">districts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cantons</hi>, of the Gauls and Germans: <cit><quote lang="la">in Galliā ... in omnibus pagis partibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1</bibl>; 22; 6, 23; 7, 64; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Alamannorum pagos aliquos esse reputaret hostiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33406.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33406.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The country people</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">festus in pratis vacat otioso Cum bove pagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pagus agat festum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:669" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 669</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33406.3" n="B" level="2"> Novem Pagi, <hi rend="ital">a city in Belgic Gaul</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Dieuze</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 2, 9</bibl> (al. Decem Pagi).</sense></entryFree>
pala: <entryFree id="n33407" type="main" key="pa_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from pagela, from pago, pango: <cit><quote lang="la">pala a pangendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=134" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 134</bibl></cit> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n33407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spade.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33407.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">palas vendundas sibi ait ... ut hortum fodiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcula VIII., palas IV.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palae innixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncosus ager verti pala debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palis laxatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 17, 27, § 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:45" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33407.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33407.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A peel</hi> for putting bread into the oven, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n33407.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A winnowing-shovel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 3</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 371</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33407.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The bezel</hi> of a ring = funda: <cit><quote lang="la">palam anuli ad palmam convertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33407.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The shoulder-blade</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:35" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33407.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An Indian tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the plantain-tree</hi>: Musa Paradisiaca, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 6, 12, § 24</bibl>. <cb n="PALA" /></sense></entryFree>
palabundus: <entryFree id="n33408" type="main" key="pa_la_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pālābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>palor</etym>, <sense id="n33408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struggling</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Judaei dispersi palabundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites, Auct. Itin. Alex. 56 Mai: oves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 42, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palacrana: <entryFree id="n33409" type="foreign" key="palacra_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palacrāna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">palacurna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Span.</etym>, <sense id="n33409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ingot of gold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palaemon: <entryFree id="n33410" type="main" key="Pa^laemon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălaemon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*palai/mwn</foreign>. <sense id="n33410.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-god</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly called</hi> Melicerta, <hi rend="ital">the son of Athamas and Ino</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">O Palaemon, sancte Neptuni comes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 15, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 823</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 542</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 17, 159</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33410.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălae-mŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the seagod Palœmon</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Corinthian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:380" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 380</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palaemoniae coronae,</quote> <trans><tr>won at the Isthmian games</tr>, <tr>which were celebrated in honor of Palœmon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Th. 289</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33410.2" n="II" level="1"> Remmius Palaemon, <hi rend="ital">a Roman grammarian in the time of Tiberius and Claudius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:60" default="NO">1, 5, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:451" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 451</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:215" default="NO">7, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:86" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33410.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shepherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palaeno: <entryFree id="n33411" type="main" key="Pa^laeno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălaeno</orth>, <itype>ūs or ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Danaides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palaepharsalus: <entryFree id="n33412" type="main" key="Pa^laepharsa_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălaepharsālus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Old Pharsalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Pharsalus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 1</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palaephatius: <entryFree id="n33413" type="main" key="Pa^laepha^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălaephătĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n33413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Palœphatus</hi> (a Grecian mythographer), <hi rend="ital">Palœphatian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palaepolitanus: <entryFree id="n33414" type="main" key="Pa^laepo^li_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălaepŏlītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n33414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Campanian city Palœpolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joined to Neapolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Palœpolitan.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălaepŏlītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Palœpolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palaeste: <entryFree id="n33415" type="main" key="Pa^laeste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălaestē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*palaisth/</foreign>, <sense id="n33415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport in Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> dub. (al. Pharsalia).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33415.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălaestīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Palœste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Epirus</hi> (as the entrance to the Lower World), <hi rend="ital">Palœstian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palaestinae deae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Furies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:236" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 236</bibl></cit> (where Meletinas is a better reading): <cit><quote lang="la">arenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 460</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palaestes: <entryFree id="n33416" type="greek" key="pa^laestes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălaestes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">palaisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestler</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
palaestina: <entryFree id="n33417" type="main" key="Pa^laesti_na^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălaestīnă</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pălest-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pă-laestīnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*palaisti/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n33417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the country of Palestine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:66 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 66 sq.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33417.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pă-laestīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Palestine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>the Euphrates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:464" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 17</bibl></cit> (7, 18): <cit><quote lang="la">Palaestini simul Hebraeique liquores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:213" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 213</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălaestīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Palestine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 14, 29</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the Philistines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 21, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33417.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălaestīnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Palestinian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palaestra: <entryFree id="n33418" type="greek" key="pa^laestra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălaestra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">palai/stra</foreign>, <sense id="n33418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestling-school</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrestling-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place of exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palœstra</hi>, where youths, with their bodies naked and anointed with oil, practised gymnastic exercises. Such palæstrae were also attached to private houses: <cit><quote lang="la">in palaestram venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in palaestrā atque in foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas in palaestrā ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars in gramineis exercent membra palaestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 642</bibl></cit>. —Of the palæstrae in private houses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Fibrenus) tantum complectitur quod satis sit modicae palaestrae loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33418.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33418.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wrestling</hi> in the palæstra, <hi rend="ital">the exercise of wrestling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non utuntur in ipsā lusione artificio proprio palaestrae, sed indicat ipse motus, didicerintne palaestram an nesciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercent patrias oleo labente palaestras Nudati socii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora agresti nudant palaestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uncta palaestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidā palaestrā ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:16:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 149</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 615</bibl>.—Mercury was regarded as the founder of wrestling combats, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 661</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33418.3" n="B" level="2"> In the lang. of comedy, <hi rend="ital">a brothel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33418.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Exercises in the school of rhetoric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhetorical exercises</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a school of rhetoric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a school</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidum genus verborum sed palaestrae magis et olei, quam hujus civilis turbae ac fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 18, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam armis institutus, quam palaestrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic adjuvet, ut palaestra histrionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">56, 186</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 68, 228</bibl>: Antipater habuit (in scribendā historiā) vires agrestes ille quidem atque horridas sine nitore ac palaestrā,<pb n="1291" /> <cb n="PALA" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 6</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n33418.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An art</hi> or <hi rend="ital">skill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utemur eā palaestrā, quam a te didicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palaestrice: <entryFree id="n33419" type="main" key="palaestri^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palaestrĭcē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">palaestrĭcōs</orth>, <sense id="n33419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. palaestricus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
palaestricus: <entryFree id="n33420" type="greek" key="pa^laestri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălaestrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">palaistrikos</foreign>, <sense id="n33420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the palœstra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palœstric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro exercitu gymnastico et palaestrico hoc habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestrici motūs,</quote> <trans><tr>the motions of a dancingmaster</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">doctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies decora et suci palaestrici plena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 315</bibl></cit>.—Sarcastically of Verres: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestricus praetor, because he illegally decided a cause in favor of a company of wrestlers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:22:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 22, § 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33420.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n33420.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălaestrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a teacher of the art of wrestling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33420.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălae-strĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the art of wrestling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 11</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33420.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălaestrĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">after the manner of the palœstra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestrice spatiari in xysto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33420.5" n="2" level="3"> In the Greek form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălaestrĭcōs</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">palaistrikw=s</foreign>, the same (ante-class.), Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 154, 12</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 157, v. 154 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
palaestrita: <entryFree id="n33421" type="greek" key="pa^laestri_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălaestrīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">palaistri/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n33421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the director of a wrestling-school</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 14, § 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 22, § 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubricus palaestrita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:25" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33421.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a wrestler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palaga: <entryFree id="n33422" type="main" key="palaga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palaga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ingot of gold</hi> [Span.], <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 77</bibl> (al. palacra).</sense></entryFree>
palam: <entryFree id="n33423" type="main" key="pa^lam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>locative form; cf.: clam, perperam, etc.; root pal-, pla-; as in <foreign lang="greek">platu/s</foreign>, planus; cf. pellis; hence, on the surface, on the open plain, and so</etym>, <sense id="n33423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">openly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publicly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisguisedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi> (cf.: publice, vulgo, aperte; opp.: clam, occulte, secreto, etc.; class.). </sense><sense id="n33423.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quae in foro palam Syracusis ... gesta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:33:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 33, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferre argentum palam atque aperte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non ex insidiis, sed aperte ac palam elaboratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 12, 38</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">palam agere coepit et aperte dicere occidendum Milonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 18</bibl>: PALAM LVCI, Tab. Bant. vers. 15; so ib. vers. 22; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arma in templum Castoris luce palam comportarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut luce palam in foro saltet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>: gaudia clamque palamque, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 247 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 9, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non per praestigias, sed palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non occulte sed palam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">49: palam ... obscurius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae furtim fruuntur (frumento), domini palam et libere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam ante oculos omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec palam nec secreto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam ... intus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod palam abnuerat inter secreta convivii largitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 57</bibl></cit>, in late Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">in palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 14, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 8, 17</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33423.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33423.3" n="A" level="2"> Palam est or factum est, <hi rend="ital">it is public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam est res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec commemoro quae sunt palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam ante oculos omnium esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam factum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hāc re palam factā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,023:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Han. 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">palam facere suis, quo loco Eumenes esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus de morte ut palam factum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dion. 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum exspirasset Tarquinius, celatā morte, suas opes firmavit: tum demum palam factum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nondum palam facto vivi mortuique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui palam facti parricidii obnoxius erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 56, 3</bibl></cit>; so (euphemist.), ut de Claudio palam factum est, <hi rend="ital">when the death of Claudius was announced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitur Cato incumbens gladio simul de se ac de republicā palam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem nobis prophetae palam faciunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces audire palam est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is well known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 70, 89, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to say openly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam ferente Hannibale ab se Minucium, se ab Fabio victum,</quote> <trans><tr>making no secret of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 29, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33423.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi>, with <case>abl.</case>, analogous to clam and coram, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the presence of</hi> one (not ante-Aug., and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">te palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meque palam de me tuto male saepe loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meque palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marte palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:569" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 569</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:444" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 444</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem creditori palam populo solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 5" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 5</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PALA" /></sense></entryFree>
palamedes: <entryFree id="n33424" type="main" key="Pa^la^me_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălămēdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*palamh/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n33424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Nauplius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Eubœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who lost his life before Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through the artifices of Ulysses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 26, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 19, 28</bibl>. He is said, by observing the flight of cranes, to have invented the letters <foreign lang="greek">*q, *c, *f, *x</foreign>, acc. to others the letters <foreign lang="greek">*u</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*d</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:75:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 75, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33424.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălămēdēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Palamedean</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 206</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33424.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pă-lămēdĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Palamedic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palamediaci calculi,</quote> <trans><tr>the counters in the game of draughts which Palamedes invented</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 8, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33424.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălămēdĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Palamedic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Techn. de Monosyll. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palangae: <entryFree id="n33425" type="main" key="pa^langae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălangae</orth>, v. phalangae.</entryFree>
palangarius: <entryFree id="n33426" type="main" key="pa^langa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălangārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pălanc-</orth>), v. 1. phalangarius.</entryFree>
palantieis: <entryFree id="n33427" type="main" key="Pa^lanti^eis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălantĭeis</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*palantiei=s</foreign>, <sense id="n33427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the immigrants who accompanied Evander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 53</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
palanto: <entryFree id="n33428" type="main" key="Pa^lanto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălanto</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Latinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 53</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
palara: <entryFree id="n33429" type="main" key="pa^la_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălāra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird</hi>, otherwise unknown: dulce palara sonat, quam dicunt nomine drostam, Auct. Carm. Phil. 11.</sense></entryFree>
palaris: <entryFree id="n33430" type="main" key="pa_la_ri^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pālārĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. palus</etym>, <sense id="n33430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to pales</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stakes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva palaris,</quote> <trans><tr>from which pales are fetched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33430.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pālārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the exercise of tilting against a stake;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">the place of this exercise</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 21</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
palasea: <entryFree id="n33431" type="main" key="pa^la_se^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălāsĕa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">plāsĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tailpiece</hi> or <hi rend="ital">buttock</hi> of an ox offered for sacrifice, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palatha: <entryFree id="n33432" type="greek" key="pa^la^tha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălătha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pala/qh</foreign>, <sense id="n33432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dried fruit</hi>, usually <hi rend="ital">figs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 16, 1</bibl>; id. Judith, 10, 5.</sense></entryFree>
palatinus: <entryFree id="n33433" type="main" key="Pa^la_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălātīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Palatium, II.</entryFree>
palatio: <entryFree id="n33434" type="main" key="pa_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pālātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. palus</etym>, <sense id="n33434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a driving in of pales</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stakes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palatium: <entryFree id="n33435" type="main" key="Pa^la_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălātĭum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāl-</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pall-</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:70:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 70, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:102:13" default="NO">9, 102, 13</bibl>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pala/tion, *palla/ntion</foreign> [root pa-, to protect, nourish; Sanscr. pala, shepherd; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ai)-po/los oi)o-po/los</foreign>; <sense id="n33435.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Lat. pasco],</quote> <trans><tr>one of the seven hills of Rome</tr>, <tr>that which was first built upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 53</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: Palatium id est mons Romae, appellatus est, quod ibi pecus pascens balare consueverit, vel quod palare, id est errare, ibi pecudes solerent; <cit><quote lang="la">alii, quod ibi Hyperborei filia Palanto habitaverit, quae ex Hercule Latinum peperit, alii eundem, quod Pallas ibi sepultus sit, aestimant appellari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl></cit> Müll.—Augustus had his residence on the Palatine; hence, since the Aug. period, </sense><sense id="n33435.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălātĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a palace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatia fulgent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreta palatia matris,</quote> <trans><tr>the temple of Cybele</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 23</bibl></cit>: magni palatia caeli, <hi rend="ital">the palace of the sky</hi> (of the seat of Jupiter), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 16, 18</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n33435.2" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălātīnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāl-</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pall-</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:39:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 39, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:24:1" default="NO">9, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:79:2" default="NO">9, 79, 2</bibl>; 9, 86, 7; 11, 8, 5; 13, 91, 1), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Palatium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Palatine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 54</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Evander,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <trans><tr>the vultures which Remus saw on the Palatium</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo, so called because he had a temple on the Palatine Hill, built by Augustus, in which also was a library founded by him,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:19:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <trans><tr>which Livia caused to be celebrated in honor of Augustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colossus,</quote> <trans><tr>the colossal statue of Nero</tr>, <tr>on the Palatium</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:60:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 60, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl>: Palatina pars urbis, <hi rend="ital">the tenth region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called simply</hi> Palatina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 13</bibl>: Palatina tribus, <hi rend="ital">one of the four city tribes</hi>: Calvu' Palatina vir nobilis ac bonu' bello, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 462, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Claudius C. F. Palatina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:43:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 43, § 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 36, 11</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălātīni</orth>,<itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people of the Palatine Mount</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33435.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the imperial palace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatina laurus,</quote> <trans><tr>which stood in front of the imperial palace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:953" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 953</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atriensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:117" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia,</quote> <trans><tr>offices about the court</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 14" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Ep. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Treb. Gall. 17.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălātīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an officer of the palace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chamberlain</hi>: Parthenius<cb n="PALI" />  palatinus, <hi rend="ital">Domitian's chamberlain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:45:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 45, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tonans,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Domitian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:40:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 40, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palatua: <entryFree id="n33436" type="gloss" key="Pa^la_tu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălātŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tutelary goddess of the Palatine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 45</bibl> Müll.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n33436.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălātŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Palatua</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 45</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Palatualis flamen constitutus est, quod in tutelā ejus deae Palatium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=245" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 245</bibl></cit> Müll.; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 45</bibl> ib. (Ann. v. 125 Vahl.).— </sense><sense id="n33436.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălātŭar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype> (euphon. for Palatual), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an offering made at Rome on the Palatine</hi>, Fest. s. v. septimontium, p. 348 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
palatum: <entryFree id="n33437" type="main" key="pa^la_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and (rarely) <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. from root pa-of pasco</etym>, <sense id="n33437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the palate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33437.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">suave domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim sequitur, ut, cui cor sapiat, ei non sapiat palatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (voluptas) palato percipiatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum dare membra palato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtile palatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigra subest udo tantum cui lingua palato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 388</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 47</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum balba feris annoso verba palato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpente palato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 203</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">palata docta et erudita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33437.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the palate</hi>, as the organ of taste and judgment: <cit><quote lang="la">(Epicurus) dum palato quid sit optimum judicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis condimentum, quod sentitur latente judicio velut palato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n33437.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (of the form of the palate), <hi rend="ital">a vault</hi>: caeli, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 38</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 177</bibl>, n. 19 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
palatus: <entryFree id="n33438" type="main" key="pa^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. palatum <sense id="n33438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pale: <entryFree id="n33439" type="greek" key="pa^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n33439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestling</hi> (in post-Aug. poets): <cit><quote lang="la">unctā pale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:829" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 829</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidam nodare (al. nudare) palen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:441" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ach. 2, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocos, palem, rudentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 302</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palea: <entryFree id="n33440" type="main" key="pa^le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred with Sanscr. pala, stramen; cf.: pollen, pulvis, <foreign lang="greek">palu/nw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n33440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chaff</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgentem ad Zephyrum paleae jactantur inanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 72, § 297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:3" default="NO">6, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:22 al" default="NO">7, 3, 22 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33440.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33440.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Dross</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palea aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 36, § 134</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33440.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The wattles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gills</hi> of a cock, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33440.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Straw</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 19, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palealis: <entryFree id="n33441" type="main" key="pa^le^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>palea</etym>, <sense id="n33441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to chaff</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <trans><tr>preserved in chaff</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:29" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:21:204" default="NO">3, 21, 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palear: <entryFree id="n33442" type="main" key="pa^le^ar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălĕar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the skin that hangs down from the neck of an ox</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the dew-lap</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1041" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1041</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33442.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a collo palearibus demissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palearia pendula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:854" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 854</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a mento palearia pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:332" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 332</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33442.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the throat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocat palearibus herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 3, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palearis: <entryFree id="n33443" type="main" key="pa^le^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălĕāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to chaff</hi>: arista, Venant. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:284" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 284</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palearium: <entryFree id="n33444" type="main" key="pa^le^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălĕārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chaff-loft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paleatus: <entryFree id="n33445" type="main" key="pa^le^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixed with chaff</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:1" default="NO">12, 43, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pales: <entryFree id="n33446" type="main" key="Pa^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 113</bibl>), <sense id="n33446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tutelary deity of shepherds and cattle</hi>: Pales dicebatur dea pastorum, cujus festa Palilia dicebantur; <cit><quote lang="la">vel, ut alii volunt, dicta Parilia, quod pro partu pecoris eidem sacra fiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa Pales agros ... reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvicolam tepido lacte precare Palem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:746" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 746</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 14</bibl> (36): <cit><quote lang="la">fecunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:22" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palestinus: <entryFree id="n33447" type="main" key="Pa^lesti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălestīnus</orth>, v. Palaestinus.</entryFree>
palica: <entryFree id="n33448" type="main" key="Pa^li_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Sicily.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălīci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Palicans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:219" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 219</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palicanus: <entryFree id="n33449" type="main" key="Pa^li_ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălīcānus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălīkānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Lollia, <hi rend="ital">which sprang from the Sicilian town of Palica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:41:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 41, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Lollius Palicanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>, n. 3.</sense></entryFree>
palici: <entryFree id="n33450" type="main" key="Pa^li_ci1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălīci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 585</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 10, 25</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sons of Jupiter and the nymph Thalia or Ætna; they were worshipped at Palica in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where were a temple and two lakes sacred to them</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as enforcers of oaths</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promoters of fertility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and as sea-gods</hi>, Macr. S. <pb n="1292" /> <cb n="PALL" /> 5, 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 584</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna Palicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 406</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:155" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n33451" type="main" key="Pa^li_ci2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălīci</orth>, v. Palica.</entryFree>
palilia: <entryFree id="n33452" type="main" key="Pa^li_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. Palilis, II.</entryFree>
palilicius: <entryFree id="n33453" type="main" key="Pa^li_li_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălīlīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Palilia</etym>, <sense id="n33453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Palilia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Palilian</hi>: Palilicium sidus, <hi rend="ital">the Hyades</hi>, because they vanished in the evening twilight on the festival of the Palilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 66, § 247</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palilis: <entryFree id="n33454" type="main" key="Pa^li_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Pales</etym>, <sense id="n33454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pales</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma Palilis,</quote> <trans><tr>a fire of straw and hay</tr>, <tr>over which the rustics leaped at the feast of Pales</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:798" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festa Palilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 774</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:87" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 87</bibl>.—Also as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: </sense><sense id="n33454.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype> (euphon. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Părīlĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 69</bibl> et saep.; cf. Prob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 43</bibl> P.; Mar. Vict. p. 2470 P.), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the feast of Pales</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the shepherd festival</hi>, celebrated on the 21st of April, the anniversary of the foundation of Rome, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:3:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 47, 98</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:721" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 721</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:89" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:1:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:4:75" default="NO">5, 4, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:72" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=236" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 236</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Părīlīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">occurring at the time of the Parilia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 66, § 247</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palilogia: <entryFree id="n33455" type="greek" key="pa^li^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălĭlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">palilogi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the emphatic repetition of a word</hi> or <hi rend="ital">idea</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 533</bibl>, who cites from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl>: nos, nos, dico aperte, nos consules desumus.</sense></entryFree>
palimbacchius: <entryFree id="n33456" type="greek" key="pa^limbacchi_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălimbacchīus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">palimbakxei=os</foreign>, in prosody, i. q. antibacchius, <sense id="n33456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an antibacchic</hi>, ¯¯˘, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 82</bibl>; Diom. pp. 461 and 476 P.</sense></entryFree>
palimpissa: <entryFree id="n33457" type="greek" key="pa^limpissa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălimpissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pali/mpissa</foreign>, <sense id="n33457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pitch boiled twice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 7, 24, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palimpsestus: <entryFree id="n33458" type="greek" key="pa^limpsestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălimpsestus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pali/myhstos</foreign>, <sense id="n33458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parchment from which the old writing has been erased for the purpose of writing upon it again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a palimpsest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palinodia: <entryFree id="n33459" type="greek" key="pa^li^no_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălĭnōdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">palinw|di/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the repetition of a song.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33459.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33459.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a recantation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palinode</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palinodiam canere,</quote> <trans><tr>to recant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palinurus: <entryFree id="n33460" type="main" key="Pa^li^nu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălĭnūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pali/nouros</foreign>, <sense id="n33460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pilot of Æneas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who fell asleep at the helm and tumbled into the sea off the coast of Lucania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whence the name of the promontory near the spot</hi> (now perh. <hi rend="ital">Punta dello Spartimento</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:847" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 847</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">871</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 337</bibl>; 381; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 28</bibl>. —In a lusus verbb. with <foreign lang="greek">pa/lin ou)rei=n</foreign>, iterum meiere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:78:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 78, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palitans: <entryFree id="n33461" type="hapax" key="pa_li^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pālĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from the obsol. palito, <sense id="n33461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom (haec oves) eunt sic a pecu palitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
paliuraeus: <entryFree id="n33462" type="main" key="pa^li^u_raeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălĭūraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paliurus</etym>, <sense id="n33462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with Christ's-thorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
paliurus: <entryFree id="n33463" type="greek" key="pa^li^u_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălĭūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pali/ouros</foreign>, <sense id="n33463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Christ's-thorn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 39</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 71, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:121" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 30, 53, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 34, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palla: <entryFree id="n33464" type="main" key="palla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred with pellis; cf. Doed. Syn. 5, p. 211</etym>, <sense id="n33464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a long and wide upper garment of the Roman ladies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">held together by brooches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a robe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mantle</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stola, peplum, chlamys),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro longae tegmine pallae Tigridis exuviae per dorsum a vertice pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palla superba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 13, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:104:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 104, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scissā pallā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:262" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 262</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker, Gall. 3, p. 144 (2d edit.).—</sense><sense id="n33464.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33464.2" n="A" level="2"> In the poets also of a garment worn by men, e. g. of <hi rend="ital">the dress of a tragic actor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">personae pallaeque repertor honestae Aeschylus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 278</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 18, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 12</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of the cithara-player Arion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 107</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Phœbus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 35</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Boreas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 705</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:39" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 39</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Osiris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:47" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 47</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:262" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 262</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Jason</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:718" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 718</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33464.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An under-garment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharoedus palla inaurata indutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
