Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallamque induta rigentem insuper aurato circumvelatur amictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 262</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:525" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 525</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:93:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 93, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:39" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33464.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A curtain</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">peripe/tasma</foreign>, velum, palla, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inter dicentes et audientem palla interesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:22:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pallaca: <entryFree id="n33465" type="greek" key="palla^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallăca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pallakh/</foreign>, <sense id="n33465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a concubine</hi><cb n="PALL" />  (pure Lat. paelex), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pallacana: <entryFree id="n33466" type="main" key="palla^ca_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallăcāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of onion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a leek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> gethyum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palladium: <entryFree id="n33467" type="main" key="Palla^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallădĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. 1. Pallas, II. B.</entryFree>
palladius: <entryFree id="n33468" type="main" key="Palla^di^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallădĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Pallas, II. A.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33469" type="main" key="Palla^di^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallădĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> So, Palladius Rutilius Taurus Aemilianus, <hi rend="ital">probably a Roman by birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who lived in the fourth century of the Christian era</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the author of a work on agriculture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in fourteen books.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pallanteum: <entryFree id="n33470" type="main" key="Pallante_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallantēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. Pallas, II. A. 2.</entryFree>
pallanteus: <entryFree id="n33471" type="main" key="Pallante_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallantēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Pallas, II. A.</entryFree>
pallantias: <entryFree id="n33472" type="main" key="Pallanti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallantĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, v. 2. Pallas, II. B.</entryFree>
pallantis: <entryFree id="n33473" type="main" key="Pallantis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallantis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis and ĭdos</itype>, v. 2. Pallas, II. C.</entryFree>
pallantius: <entryFree id="n33474" type="main" key="Pallanti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallantĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Pallas, II. D.</entryFree>
pallaris: <entryFree id="n33475" type="gloss" key="palla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>palla</etym>, <sense id="n33475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> palla: <cit><quote lang="la">palla, pallaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pallas: <entryFree id="n33476" type="main" key="Palla^s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallăs</orth>, <itype>ădis and ădos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*palla/s</foreign>. <sense id="n33476.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Surname of the Greek goddess Athene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and hence of the corresponding Minerva of the Romans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of war and wisdom; the inventress of working in wool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and of the cultivation of the olive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which account the olive-tree was sacred to her</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas Minerva est dicta, quod Pallantem Gigantem interfecerit, vel, sicut putabant, quod in Pallante palude nata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas . . . Proeliis audax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 263</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palladis ales,</quote> <trans><tr>the owl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:89" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallados arbor,</quote> <trans><tr>the olive-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 518</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rami Palladis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratā Pallade, i. q. invitā Minervā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:826" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 826</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33476.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33476.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Oil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infusā Pallade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 19, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33476.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The olive-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dat quoque baciferam Pallada rarus ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33476.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The Palladium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helenum raptā cum Pallade captum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallade conspectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:293" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 293</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33476.5" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The number seven</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 738</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33476.6" n="5" level="3"> For <hi rend="ital">Vesta</hi>, because the Palladium stood in the temple of Vesta: Pallados ignes, Prop 4 (5), 4, 45.— </sense><sense id="n33476.7" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. </sense><sense id="n33476.8" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallădĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*palla/dios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pallas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Palladian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen Palladium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pallas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegis,</quote> <trans><tr>of Pallas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palladiā gaudent silvā vivacis olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 181</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">latices,</quote> <trans><tr>oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <trans><tr>an olive-wreath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <trans><tr>Troy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 42: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <trans><tr>Athens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <trans><tr>shown to Pallas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 17, 133</bibl></cit>: pinus, <hi rend="ital">the Argo</hi>, because built under Minerva's direction, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:475" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 475</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <trans><tr>inspired by Pallas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:408" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 408</bibl></cit>: forum, <hi rend="ital">the Roman forum</hi>, because there stood a temple of Minerva, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palladia Alba, because Domitian caused the Quinquatria in honor of Pallas to be annually celebrated there,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palladia Tolosa, because the sciences flourished there,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:100:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 100, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>skilful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:13:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lotos,</quote> <trans><tr>the flute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 51, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33476.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallădĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the image</hi> or <hi rend="ital">statue of Pallas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the reign of Ilus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fell from heaven at Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and during the Trojan war was carried off by Ulysses and Diomed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because the fate of the city depended on the possession of this image. It afterwards came from Greece to Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Metellus saved it from the temple of Vesta when the latter was burned down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:531" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 531</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 45, § 141</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33477" type="main" key="Pallas2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype> (<case>voc.</case> Pallā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:411 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 411 al.</bibl>; also Pallas and Pallan, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 702</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/llas</foreign>, <sense id="n33477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several mythic and historical personages.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33477.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Pandion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of the fifth Minerva</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 500</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33477.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the great-grandfather of Evander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 54</bibl> Serv.—</sense><sense id="n33477.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Evander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33477.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One of the giants</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Gigant. 94</bibl>; Fest. s. v Pallas, p. 220.—</sense><sense id="n33477.5" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A freedman of the emperor Claudius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proverbial for his wealth; slain by Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:109" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 10, 47, § 134</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33477.6" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n33477.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallantēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pallas</hi> (the ancestor of <cb n="PALL" /> Evander), <hi rend="ital">Pallantian</hi>: moenia Pallantea, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the city of Pallanteum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Italy</hi> (v. in the foll.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 196</bibl> and 241: <cit><quote lang="la">apex,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Palatine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Honor. 644</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33477.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallantēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n33477.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the residence of Pallas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33477.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The city founded by Evander in Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the site where Rome afterwards stood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">341</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33477.11" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallantĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Aurora</hi>, so called because descended from Hyperion, the uncle of the giant Pallas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:373" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 373</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 420</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33477.12" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallantis</orth>, <itype>ĭdos and ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Aurora</hi> (v. Pallantias, supra), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> M 15, 700</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the day</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:567" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 567</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33477.13" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallantĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pallas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pallantian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallantius heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Evander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:647" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 647</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pallatinus: <entryFree id="n33478" type="main" key="Palla_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallātīnus</orth>, v. Palatinus.</entryFree>
pallene: <entryFree id="n33479" type="main" key="Palle_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pallh/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n33479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peninsula and town of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Thermaic Gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Phlegra, <hi rend="ital">where the battle between the gods and the giants took place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 356</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 979" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 979</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33479.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallēnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pallene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33479.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallēnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pallenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isthmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pallens: <entryFree id="n33480" type="main" key="pallens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from palleo.</entryFree>
palleo: <entryFree id="n33481" type="main" key="palle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. palitas, gray; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pello/s, pelidno/s, polio/s</foreign>; cf. pullus</etym>, <sense id="n33481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">look pale.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33481.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudat, pallet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallent amisso sanguine venae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:824" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 824</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu sceleris futuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:465" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:468" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea rugosa pallebunt ora senectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:38:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 38, 12</bibl></cit>.— Esp. of lovers: palleat omnis amans; <cit><quote lang="la">hic est color aptus amanti,</quote> <trans><tr>must look pale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 729</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 17</bibl>.—Also through indolence, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:24" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33481.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33481.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">look sallow</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">yellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum quoque palluit auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca palleat nummis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:44:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 44, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:55:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 55, 1</bibl>; so, <hi rend="ital">to become turbid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tagus auriferis pallet turbatus arenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:561" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 561</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33481.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lose its natural color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to change color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et numquam Herculeo numine pallet ebur,</quote> <trans><tr>always remains white</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 82: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera pallent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:406" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vitio caeli palleat aegra seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:688" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 688</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallet nostris Aurora venenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 209</bibl></cit>: pallere diem, Luc 7, 177—</sense><sense id="n33481.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos pallere colores,</quote> <trans><tr>to change color often</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33481.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33481.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To grow pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be sick</hi> with desire, <hi rend="ital">to long for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly desire</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitione malā aut argenti pallet amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:47" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33481.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To grow pale</hi> at any thing, <hi rend="ital">to be anxious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fearful.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>on account of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnia fulgura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:223" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marco sub judice palles?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:8" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33481.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scatentem Belluis pontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraternos ictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:184" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 184</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33481.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To grow pale</hi> by excessive application to a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">iratum Eupoliden praegrandi cum sene palles,</quote> <trans><tr>read yourself pale over Eupolis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:124" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc utile multis Pallere, i. e. studere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:96" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilandum, nitendum, pallendum est,</quote> <trans><tr>of close study</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pallens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wan</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n33481.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra modis pallentia miris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae Erebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Lower World</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:408" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 408</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Styx</tr>, <tr>the Cocytus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:21" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:175" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallens morte futurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallentes terrore puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 487</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33481.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33481.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Of a faint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pale color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pale-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greenish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yellowish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darkcolored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallentes violae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmā e viridi pallens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol jungere pallentes equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:76" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:58:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 58, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33481.14" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that makes pale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philtra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:6:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:701" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 701</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33481.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <trans><tr>pale</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <trans><tr>bad</tr>, <tr>vicious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:15" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pallesco: <entryFree id="n33482" type="main" key="pallesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallesco</orth>, <itype>pallăi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n33482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [palleo], <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn pale.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33482.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ut qui timent <pb n="1293" /> <cb n="PALL" /> sanguine ex ore decedente pallescant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallescere curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā pallescere culpā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallescet super his,</quote> <trans><tr>will turn pale with emotion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbraticā vitā pallescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:76" default="NO">12, 10, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33482.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to turn pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sallow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallescunt frondes,</quote> <trans><tr>wither</tr>, <tr>fade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viso pallescit flamma veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:586" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 586</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palliastrum: <entryFree id="n33483" type="main" key="palli^astrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallĭastrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pallium</etym>, <sense id="n33483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ragged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorry mantle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 350</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palliatus: <entryFree id="n33484" type="main" key="palli^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dressed in a</hi> pallium, <hi rend="ital">cloaked</hi>, usually said of Greeks. </sense><sense id="n33484.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti Graeci palliati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3,9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeculus judex modo palliatus, modo togatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palliata signa Phidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi palliati topiariam facere videantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Grecian statues</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: fabulae palliatae, <hi rend="ital">comedies in which Greek characters were introduced in the Greek dress</hi> (opp. the fabulae togatae, in which Roman manners and dresses predominated), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 4, p. 487</bibl> P.; Don. Fragm. ante Comm. in Ter.—</sense><sense id="n33484.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">covered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protected</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pallidulus: <entryFree id="n33485" type="main" key="palli^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n33485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [pallidus], <hi rend="ital">palish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat pale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pallidus: <entryFree id="n33486" type="main" key="palli^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>palleo</etym>, <sense id="n33486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pallid</hi> (cf.: lividus, luridus). </sense><sense id="n33486.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides ut pallidus omnis Cenā desurgat dubiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora buxo Pallidiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:5:72" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 5, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asturii scrutator pallidus auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 298</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 618</bibl>: recto vultu et pallidus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">well</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sick</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:189" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oriens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 78, § 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae, quae sunt omnium pallidissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 89</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of the Lower World: <cit><quote lang="la">pallida turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:38" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ditis profundi Pallida regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 456</bibl></cit>: pallida Leti loca, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 6</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 109 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33486.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33486.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That makes pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pallid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallida mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:7:36" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aconita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 322</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33486.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Musty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mouldy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustate ficus fit pallidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33486.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Livid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes inauratā pallidior statuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:81:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 81, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33486.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33486.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pale with love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in love</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:7:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallidus in lentā Naïde Daphnis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 732</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 6, 25</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33486.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pale with fright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affrighted</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palliolatim: <entryFree id="n33487" type="main" key="palli^o^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallĭŏlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>pallium</etym>, <sense id="n33487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dressed in a mantle</hi> very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">palliolatim amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Orat. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Orat. 1</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
palliolatus: <entryFree id="n33488" type="main" key="palli^o^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallĭŏlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>palliolum</etym>, <sense id="n33488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with a cloak-cape</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palliolatus novo more praesedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:33:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicae palliolatae,</quote> <trans><tr>hooded mantles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Bonos. 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palliolum: <entryFree id="n33489" type="main" key="palli^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pallium</etym>. <sense id="n33489.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a small Greek mantle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cloak</hi>: saepe est etiam sub palliolo sordido sapientia, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:23:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 23, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palliolum in collum conice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrugineum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 27, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opertus palliolo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33489.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a covering for the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palliolum, sicut fascias et focalia et aurium ligamenta, sola excusare potest valetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:144" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 734</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:13:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 13, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pallium: <entryFree id="n33490" type="main" key="pallium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi> [cf. palla]. </sense><sense id="n33490.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n33490.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A coverlet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et gravius justo pallia pondus habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerosa pallia jactat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:236" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc queror in toto non sidere pallia lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:3:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33490.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A pall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrepto pallio retexi corpora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 133, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 342, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33490.4" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A curtain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae festis suspendam pallia portis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 726</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33490.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a Greek cloak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mantle</hi>, esp. as the dress of the Grecian philosophers. The Romans were accustomed to wear it only when they resided among Greeks. It was also the dress of the hetaerae, both Greek and Roman, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium in collum conicere (as was customary with persons about to exert themselves),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soleas mihi late: pallium inice in me huc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 8</bibl>: umerum pallio <cb n="PALM" /> onerare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum iste cum pallio purpureo talarique tunicā versaretur in conviviis muliebribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consularis homo soccos habuit et pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amica corpus ejus texit suo pallio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:69:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 69, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pallio et crepidis inambulare in gymnasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam veteres ad calceos usque demittebant ut Graeci pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:143" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 143</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">solos esse Atticos credunt quādam eloquentiae frugalitate contentos, ac semper manum intra pallium continentis,</quote> <trans><tr>speaking with calmness and reserve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 138</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> for <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 153</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica propior pallio est,</quote> <trans><tr>the shirt is nearer than the coat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a togā ad pallium,</quote> <trans><tr>of sinking from a high to a lower rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33490.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33490.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The toga</hi>, and, in gen., <hi rend="ital">an upper garment</hi> of any kind, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:63:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 63, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:59:9" default="NO">8, 59, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:16:5" default="NO">11, 16, 5</bibl>; 11, 23, 12.—</sense><sense id="n33490.8" n="2" level="3"> Since the pallium was the philosopher's cloak, <hi rend="ital">a philosophic career</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pallium reverti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pallor: <entryFree id="n33491" type="main" key="pallor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>palleo</etym>, <sense id="n33491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pale color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pallor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33491.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudorem rubor, terrorem pallor et tremor consequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albus ora pallor inficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luteus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partemque coloris Luridus exsangues pallor convertit in herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 267</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidus pallor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confuderat oris exsanguis notas pallor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallor ora occupat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femineus pallor in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:48:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:334" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 334</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp. of lovers: tinctus violā pallor amantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 790</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:5:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 5, 21</bibl>.—Of the Lower World: <cit><quote lang="la">pallor hiemsque tenent late loca senta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 436</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 628</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae palloribus omnia pingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot hominum pallores,</quote> <trans><tr>the paleness of death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33491.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33491.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mustiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mouldiness</hi>: pallor, tineae omnia caedunt, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 462, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti umidi pallore volumina (bibliothecarum) corrumpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne (dolia) pallorem capiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:41:4" default="NO">12, 41, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33491.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A disagreeable color</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsightliness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palloribus omnia pingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallorem ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 759</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurus solis,</quote> <trans><tr>in an eclipse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 30, 30, § 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33491.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">alarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terror</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palla pallorem incutit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tibi pallori, Cynthia, versus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantus pro conjuge pallor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:70" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notare aliquem pallore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 55</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33491.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pallor</orth>, personified as <hi rend="ital">the god of fear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pallula: <entryFree id="n33492" type="main" key="pallu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pallŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>palla</etym>, <sense id="n33492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cloak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mantle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscissa pallula est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palma: <entryFree id="n33493" type="greek" key="palma1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> <etym><foreign lang="greek">pala/mh</foreign>; Sanscr. phal, to open</etym>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the palm</hi> of the hand. </sense><sense id="n33493.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 32, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavis undam de flumine palmis Sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem palmā concutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem contundere palmā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 128</bibl></cit>: os hominis liberi manus suae palmā verberare, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33493.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33493.3" n="A" level="2"> (Pars pro toto.) <hi rend="ital">The hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compressan' palma an porrecta ferio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmarum intentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passis palmis salutem petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneras arcebant vincula palmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplices tendens ad sidera palmas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexus tremulis altaria palmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:44" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sole</hi> of a goose's foot: <cit><quote lang="la">palmas pedum anseris torrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 27, § 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The broad end</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blade of an oar</hi>: palmarum pulsus, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 151, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerula verrentes abiegnis aequora palmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A palm-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a palm</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">foi=nic</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ejus summo, sicut palmae, rami quam late diffunduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in palmarum foliis primo scriptitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 11, 21, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:223" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 42, 81, § 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor palmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbusto palmarum dives Idume,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 216</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing. collect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:76" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 76</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33493.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33493.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the palm-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a date</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quid vult palma sibi rugosaque carica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:185" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 185</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:39" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A palm-branch</hi>, e. g. which was suspended in wine to make it sweeter, <cb n="PALM" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.10" n="c" level="4"> Hence, also, <hi rend="ital">a broom made of palm-twigs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ten' lapides varios lutulentā radere palmā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 83</bibl></cit> (pro scopis ex palmā confectis, Schol.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:82" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.11" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A palm-branch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">palm-wreath</hi>, as a token of victory: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem anno (461 A.U.C.) ... palmae primum, translato e Graeciā more, victoribus datae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">more victorum cum palmā discucurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl></cit>: IMP. CAES. EX SICILIA EID. NOV. TRIVMPHAVIT, PALMAM DEDIT, <hi rend="ital">dedicated to Jupiter</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 607; so very frequently: palmam dare, Tabulae Fastorum Triumph., v. Bullet. Instit. Archaeol. 1861, p. 91; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 2, 4</bibl>; hence, </sense><sense id="n33493.12" n="e" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a token</hi> or <hi rend="ital">badge of victory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the palm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prize;</hi> and still more gen., <hi rend="ital">victory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pre-eminence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antehac est habitus parcus ... is nunc in aliam partem palmam possidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimarum palmarum gladiator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum palmam jam primus acceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:173" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 47, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Elea domum reducit Palma caelestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam palmam utinam di immortales tibi reservent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docto oratori palma danda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus rei palmam alicui deferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 227</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmā donare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbiter pugnae posuisse nudo Sub pede palmam Fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 11</bibl></cit>. —Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculum mel fert palmam,</quote> <trans><tr>bears away the palm</tr>, <tr>has the preference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.13" n="f" level="4"> Hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the topmost twig</hi> or <hi rend="ital">branch</hi> of any tree: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cujusque stipitis palma sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 10</bibl> (Mütz.)—</sense><sense id="n33493.14" n="g" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the <hi rend="ital">victor</hi> himself: <cit><quote lang="la">post Helymus subit et jam tertia palma Diores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 339</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:504:574" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 504, 574</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.15" n="h" level="4"> Of horses: <cit><quote lang="la">Eliadum palmae equarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.16" n="k" level="4"> Also, of <hi rend="ital">one about to be conquered</hi>, and who is to become the prize of the victor: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima restabat fusis jam palma duobus Virbius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:392" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 392</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.17" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A branch</hi> on a tree, esp. on a vine, = palmes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:17:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:15:3" default="NO">4, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:12" default="NO">4, 24, 12</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n33493.18" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of an Egyptian tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 22, 47, § 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.19" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An aromatic plant growing in Africa and Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 28, 62, § 134</bibl> (= elate).—</sense><sense id="n33493.20" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A marine plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 49, § 138</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33493.21" n="K" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in the Balearic islands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33494" type="main" key="palma2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, a collat. form for parma, v. parma <sense id="n33494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
palmaris: <entryFree id="n33495" type="main" key="palma_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. palma</etym>. <sense id="n33495.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hand's-breadth</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">palm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">width</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">virgulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3" default="NO">11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmarem in minutiem contrahi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 204</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33495.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of palms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of palms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palm-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33495.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that merits the palm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: dea, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of victory</hi>, because she is represented with a palm-branch, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palmarius: <entryFree id="n33496" type="main" key="palma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to palms</hi>: Insula Palmaria, <hi rend="ital">the Isle of Palms in the Tyrrhenian Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Palmarola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33496.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">palmārĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> * </sense><sense id="n33496.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which deserves the prize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a masterpiece</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id vero est, quod ego mihi puto palmarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33496.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The fee of a successful advocate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:1:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 13, 1, § 12</bibl>; cf. palmarium, <foreign lang="greek">a)cio/nikon</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
palmatias: <entryFree id="n33497" type="greek" key="palma^ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmătĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">palmati/as</foreign>, <sense id="n33497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight earthquake</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 65, 20.</sense></entryFree>
palmatus: <entryFree id="n33498" type="main" key="palma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from palmo.</entryFree>
palmensis: <entryFree id="n33499" type="main" key="palmensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. palma</etym>, <sense id="n33499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made from palms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palmes: <entryFree id="n33500" type="main" key="palme^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. palma, II. E.</etym>, <sense id="n33500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young branch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shoot of a vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vinesprig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vine-sprout</hi> (syn. pampinus). </sense><sense id="n33500.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmites vitium sarmenta appellantur, quod in modum palmarum humanarum virgulas quasi digitos edunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">palmitum duo genera sunt, alterum pampinarium, alterum fructuarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:26 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 26 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:10" default="NO">4, 22, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 1, 3, § 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam laeto turgent in palmite gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 48</bibl></cit>: stratus humi palmes, Juv. <pb n="1294" /> <cb n="PALM" /> 8, 78; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:152" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum vitis, vos palmites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 15, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33500.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33500.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A vine; a vineyard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Icario nemorosus palmite Gaurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:147" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:40:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 40, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33500.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a bough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">branch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudus arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmites arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit> (where Mützell reads palmas); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opaco palmite bacae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Nupt. Hon. 217</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palmetum: <entryFree id="n33501" type="main" key="palme_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. palma</etym>, <sense id="n33501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a palmgrove</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 184</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hiericus palmetis consita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl>. —In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palmeus: <entryFree id="n33502" type="main" key="palme^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n33502.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hand'sbreadth</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">palm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">width</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">orchis herba, caule palmeo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 62, § 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33502.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made of palms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palm-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 40, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sporta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palmiceus: <entryFree id="n33503" type="main" key="palmi^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmĭcĕus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">palmĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made of palms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palm-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmicea sporta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 11</bibl></cit> and 14.</sense></entryFree>
palmifer: <entryFree id="n33504" type="main" key="palmi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. palmafero</etym>, <sense id="n33504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">palm-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in palms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palmiferous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memphin palmiferamque Pharon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:5:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idume,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:600" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 600</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">palmiferos Arabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 478</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palmiger: <entryFree id="n33505" type="main" key="palmi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. palmagero</etym>, <sense id="n33505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">palm-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holding a palm-branch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palmipedalis: <entryFree id="n33506" type="main" key="palmi^pe^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmĭpĕdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>palmipes</etym>, <sense id="n33506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foot and a palm in height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breadth</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">limen altum palmipedale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:19:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palmipes: <entryFree id="n33507" type="main" key="palmi^pes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmĭpes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. palma-pes</etym>, <sense id="n33507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">broad-footed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres aut palmipedum in genere sunt, uti anseres, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 11, 13, § 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:256" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 47, 107, § 256</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33508" type="main" key="palmi^pes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmĭpes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>palmus-pes</etym>, <sense id="n33508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foot and a palm high</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmipedi intervallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 32, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus spectaculorum ne minus alti sint palmipede (al. palmopede),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
