palmiprimus: <entryFree id="n33509" type="spur" key="palmipri_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmiprīmus</orth>, <itype>a false reading for pharnuprius</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 102</bibl>.</entryFree>
palmira: <entryFree id="n33510" type="main" key="Palmi_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Palmīra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Palmyra.</entryFree>
palmo: <entryFree id="n33511" type="main" key="palmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmo</orth>, no <sense id="n33511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. palma</etym>. </sense><sense id="n33511.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make the print</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mark of the palm of one's hand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 1, 12</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr> <pos>P. a.</pos>—* </sense><sense id="n33511.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To tie up a vine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmare hoc est materias alligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:96" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 96</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">palmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n33511.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Marked with the palm of a hand</hi>: palmatus paries, <hi rend="ital">bearing the mark of a</hi> (bloody) <hi rend="ital">hand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 1, 11</bibl> and 12, pp. 30 and 31 Burm.: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi palmati,</quote> <trans><tr>with antlers shaped like the palm of a hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n33511.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Containing the figure of a palm-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 18, 29, § 134</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33511.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Worked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">embroidered with palmbranches</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica, usually worn by generals in their triumphal processions,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 15</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">togae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>, n. 5.—Also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">palmāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. ad Theod. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 4</bibl>: palmatus consul, <hi rend="ital">clothed with the</hi> palmata tunica, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 23, 3</bibl>: statua, Treb. Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palmopes: <entryFree id="n33512" type="main" key="palmo^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmŏpes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, v. palmipes.</entryFree>
palmosus: <entryFree id="n33513" type="main" key="palmo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. palma</etym>, <sense id="n33513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in palm-trees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmosa Selinūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 705</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palmula: <entryFree id="n33514" type="main" key="palmu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the palm of the hand.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33514.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Varr. ap. Non.-372, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">saevientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 105, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 138, 27.—</sense><sense id="n33514.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33514.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The blade of an oar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an oar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmulae appellantur remi a similitudine manūs humanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 163</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33514.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The wing of a bird</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color psittaco viridis et intimis plumulis et extimis palmulis (al. parmulis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 348, 31</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33514.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the palm-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a date</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:1:27" default="NO">2, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palmularis: <entryFree id="n33515" type="main" key="palmu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>palmula</etym>, <sense id="n33515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with the palm of the hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, 271, § 805</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palmus: <entryFree id="n33516" type="main" key="palmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. palma</etym>, <sense id="n33516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the palm</hi> of the hand. </sense><sense id="n33516.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">manūs palmum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci antiqui doron palmum vocabant: et ideo dora munera, quia manu darentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 171</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33516.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a measure of length, <hi rend="ital">a span</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">twelve</hi> <cb n="PALP" /> <hi rend="ital">digits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amomum frutex myrtuosus, palmi altitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 28, § 48</bibl></cit>: minor, a smaller measure, <hi rend="ital">a palm</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">four digits</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palmyra: <entryFree id="n33517" type="main" key="Palmy_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Palmȳra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Palmīra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*palmu/ra, *palmira</foreign>, <sense id="n33517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose ruins still remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the seat of the empire of Odenathus and Zenobia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 25, 21, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:144" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 28, 32, § 144</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Palmȳrēnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Palmīr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Palmyra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 87</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Palmȳ-rēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country around Palmyra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 143</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Palmȳrēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of the emperor</hi> L. Domitius Aurelius, <hi rend="ital">on account of his victory over Palmyra</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 276, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palo: <entryFree id="n33518" type="main" key="pa_lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pālo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. palus</etym>, <sense id="n33518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to support with pales</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stakes</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">props; to prop up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquae partes vinearum nunc palandae et alligandae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vitis paletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33519" type="main" key="pa_lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pālo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, v. palor <sense id="n33519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
palor: <entryFree id="n33520" type="main" key="pa_lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pālor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (<sense id="n33520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part.</hi> palantūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:445" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 445</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pālo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sat. 1, 43</bibl> Wernsd.; Poët. Lat. Min. 3, p. 90) [cf. Sanscr. pad, go; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pou=s, podo/s</foreign>; Lat. pes], <hi rend="ital">to wander up and down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wander about; to be dispersed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to straggle</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.;</hi> syn.: vagor, erro). </sense><sense id="n33520.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">palantes comites quom montes inter opacos Quaerimus et magna dispersos voce ciemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 575</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:973" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 973</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagi per agros palantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vagi palantesque per agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:61:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 61, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen per agros palatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palantes in agris oppressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palantes extra castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves palati ab suis gregibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatos aggressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex fugā palati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palantes error de tramite pellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga dabant palantia Teucri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 738</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palantia sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1031" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1031</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">palantesque polo stellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 55, § 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palanti amni (Nilo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insectari palantes hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palantia monstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:506" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 506</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33520.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">errare atque viam palantes quaerere vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palantes homines passim ac rationis egentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 150</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palpabilis: <entryFree id="n33521" type="main" key="palpa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. palpo</etym>, <sense id="n33521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be touched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that may be felt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palpable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae crassitudine palpabiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 10, 32, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palpamen: <entryFree id="n33522" type="main" key="palpa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stroking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caressing</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 302</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palpamentum: <entryFree id="n33523" type="main" key="palpa_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stroking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattering</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">muliebria palpamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palpatio: <entryFree id="n33524" type="main" key="palpa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n33524.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stroking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aufer hinc palpationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33524.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Trembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terror</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae et palpatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 32, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palpator: <entryFree id="n33525" type="main" key="palpa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stroker;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a flatterer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palpebra: <entryFree id="n33526" type="main" key="palpe_^bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpē^bra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">palpē^-brum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 218, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl>), <sense id="n33526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eyelid</hi> (usually in <number>plur.</number>; cf. cilium). </sense><sense id="n33526.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpebrae sunt tegmenta oculorum ... munitaeque sunt palpebrae tamquam vallo pilorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>: ipsae palpebrae, quibus mobilitas inest, et palpitatio vocabulum tribuit, etc., Lact. Opif. Dei, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:952" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 952</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Regulum resectis palpebris vigilando necaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 19, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. Tubero ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 4, 3</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33526.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33526.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the eyelashes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 56, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:156" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 99, § 156</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33526.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the eyes</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">palpebrae ejus interrogant filios hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palpebralis: <entryFree id="n33527" type="main" key="palpe_^bra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpē^brālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>palpebra</etym>, <sense id="n33527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on the eyelids</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpebrales setae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 880</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palpebraris: <entryFree id="n33528" type="main" key="palpe_^bra_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpē^brāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for the eyelids</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collyria palpebraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
palpebratio: <entryFree id="n33529" type="main" key="palpe_^bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpē^brātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>palpebro</etym>, <sense id="n33529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blinking</hi> with the eyes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3:36" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palpebro: <entryFree id="n33530" type="main" key="palpe_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpē^bro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>palpebra</etym>, <sense id="n33530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wink frequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blink</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10:70" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10, 70</bibl>. <cb n="PALU" /></sense></entryFree>
palpebrum: <entryFree id="n33531" type="main" key="palpe_^brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpē^brum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. palpebra <sense id="n33531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
palpitatio: <entryFree id="n33532" type="main" key="palpi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>palpito</etym>, <sense id="n33532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frequent and rapid motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a palpitation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordis,</quote> <trans><tr>a palpitation of the heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 5, 18, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a blinking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 10, 46, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partium singularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 4, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palpitatus: <entryFree id="n33533" type="main" key="palpi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in the <sense id="n33533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a frequent and rapid motion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palpito: <entryFree id="n33534" type="main" key="palpi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n33534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [palpo], <hi rend="ital">to move frequently and quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tremble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palpitate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33534.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cor palpitat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix micat ultima linguae, Utque salire solet mutilatae cauda colubrae, Palpitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebrum uni homini in infantiā palpitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 49, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ovo gutta sanguinis salit palpitatque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:173" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 65, § 173</bibl>.—Esp. of persons or animals in the agony of death, <hi rend="ital">to struggle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be convulsed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpitat et positas aspergit sanguine mensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semianimes palpitantesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam palpitat arvis Phaedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:439" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 439</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 756</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:62" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 62</bibl>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 134</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">hic arduus ignis Palpitat,</quote> <trans><tr>flickers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:70" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33534.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum palpitantem percussit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palpo: <entryFree id="n33535" type="main" key="palpo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pal-por</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> <etym>palpus; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ya/llw</foreign></etym>, 1, <sense id="n33535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stroke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to touch softly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pat</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn. mulceo). </sense><sense id="n33535.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo pectora praebet Virgineā palpanda manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:867" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 867</bibl></cit> Jahn <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpate lupos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum equum permulsit quis vel palpatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: tamquam si manu palpetur, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:196" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 196</bibl>: animalia blandi manu palpata magistri, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11, 91.—</sense><sense id="n33535.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33535.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To caress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheedle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flatter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33535.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sis vide ut palpatur! nullus est quando occepit, blandior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 472, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpabo, ecquonam modo possim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil asperum tetrumque palpanti est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33535.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam blande mulieri palpabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui male si palpere, recalcitrat undique tutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: scribenti palpare, Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33535.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem munere palpat Carus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 172, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33535.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To feel one's way</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">et palpes in meridie, sicut palpare solet caecus in tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 28, 29</bibl></cit>; id. Job, 5, 14.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33536" type="main" key="palpo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. palpo</etym>, <sense id="n33536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flatterer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:176" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palpus: <entryFree id="n33537" type="main" key="palpus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>nom.</case> not in use) [1. palpo], <sense id="n33537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the soft palm of the hand</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">timidam palpo percutit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpo percutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mi obtrudere non potes palpum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paltus: <entryFree id="n33538" type="main" key="Paltus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paltus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tos</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/ltos</foreign>, <sense id="n33538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 18, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12, 5</bibl> (as Greek, Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
paluda: <entryFree id="n33539" type="main" key="Pa^lu_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pălūda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (dressed in the military cloak), <sense id="n33539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Minerva</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 37</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 510 Vahl.); cf.: paluda a paludamentis, Varr. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
paludamentum: <entryFree id="n33540" type="main" key="pa^lu_da_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălūdāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindred with pallium, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n33540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a military cloak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soldier's cloak.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33540.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sagum, trabea): cognito super umeros fratris paludamento sponsi, quod ipsa confecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 539, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33540.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a general's cloak</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">paludamenta (sunt) insignia atque ornamenta militaria ... quae propterea, quod conspiciuntur qui ea habent, ac fiunt palam, paludamenta dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 37</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia militaria ornamenta paludamenta dici (ait Veranius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 253</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludamento circum laevum bracchium intorto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coccum imperatoriis dicatum paludamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 2, 3, § 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Vall. Max. 1, 6, 11: indutus aureo paludamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 3</bibl></cit>. Agrippina, the mother of Nero, wore a paludamentum of cloth of gold at the naval combat exhibited by the emperor Claudius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 63</bibl> (acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 56</bibl>: ipse, Claudius, insigni paludamento neque procul Agrippina chlamyde auratā praesidere).—Ut illi, quibus erat moris paludamento mutare praetextam, i. e., <hi rend="ital">to exchange civil administration for</hi> <pb n="1295" /> <cb n="PALU" /> <hi rend="ital">military command</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 4</bibl>; cf.: togam paludamento mutavit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">peace for war</hi>, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paludatus: <entryFree id="n33541" type="main" key="pa^lu_da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălūdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n33541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dressed in a military cloak</hi> (v. paludamentum). </sense><sense id="n33541.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=329" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 329</bibl></cit> Müll.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">a soldier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui invident stipendia paludatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33541.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">dressed in a general's cloak</hi> (class. and common): <cit><quote lang="la">cum proficiscebamini paludati in provincias ... consules vos quisquam putavit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 13, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 33, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pansa noster paludatus a. d. III. Kalend. Jan. profectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut paludati (consules) exeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non paludati, sine lictoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesedit paludatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumque paludatis ducibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:399" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 399</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula, i. e.,</quote> <trans><tr>imperial</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 596</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paludester: <entryFree id="n33542" type="main" key="pa^lu_dester"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălūdester</orth>, <itype>tris, tre</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. palus</etym>, <sense id="n33542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marshy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swampy</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">illuvies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paludicola: <entryFree id="n33543" type="main" key="pa^lu_di^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălūdĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>2. palus-colo</etym>, <sense id="n33543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dweller in fens</hi> or <hi rend="ital">marshes</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">paludicolae Sicambri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ravenna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paludifer: <entryFree id="n33544" type="main" key="pa^lu_di^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălūdĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. palusfero</etym>, <sense id="n33544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marsh-making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swamp-making</hi>: aquae, Auct. Carm. Philom. 42.</sense></entryFree>
paludigena: <entryFree id="n33545" type="main" key="pa^lu_di^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălūdĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n33545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. gen. comm.</hi> [2. palus-gigno], <hi rend="ital">marsh-born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that grows in marshes</hi>: paludigena papyrus, Poët. in Anth. Lat. 2, p. 462 Burm.</sense></entryFree>
paludivagus: <entryFree id="n33546" type="main" key="pa^lu_di^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălūdĭvăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. palusvagor</etym>, <sense id="n33546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among morasses</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">alumni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 312</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paludosus: <entryFree id="n33547" type="main" key="pa^lu_do_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălūdōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. palus</etym>, <sense id="n33547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fenny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boggy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marshy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 268</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 6, 77: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:108" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ravenna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:602" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 602</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palum: <entryFree id="n33548" type="main" key="pa_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pālum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. palus <sense id="n33548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
palumba: <entryFree id="n33549" type="main" key="pa^lumba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălumba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. palumbes.</entryFree>
palumbarius: <entryFree id="n33550" type="gloss" key="pa^lumba_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălumbārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>palumbes</etym>, <sense id="n33550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of hawk which attacks doves</hi>: palumbarius, = <foreign lang="greek">fassofo/nos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
palumbes: <entryFree id="n33551" type="main" key="pa^lumbes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălumbes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălumbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălumbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:67:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 67, 1</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pălumba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 39</bibl>) [cf. Sanscr. kadamba, diver; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ko/lumbos</foreign>, columba], <sense id="n33551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woodpigeon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ring-dove</hi>: macrosque palumbes, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 219, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 9" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9</bibl>; Cic. poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 1, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">raucae, tua cura, palumbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëriae palumbes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fronde novā puerum palumbes Texere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 91</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">palumbem alicui ad aream adducere,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish one a good opportunity to do a thing</tr>, <tr>to bring the fish to one's net</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: duae unum expetitis palumbem, <hi rend="ital">the same cock-pigeon</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the same lover</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 17</bibl>.—Palumbus was also <hi rend="ital">the name of a gladiator;</hi> hence, in a double sense: <cit><quote lang="la">Palumbum postulantibus daturum se promisit, si captus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palumbinum: <entryFree id="n33552" type="main" key="Palumbi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Palumbīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Samnites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
palumbinus: <entryFree id="n33553" type="main" key="pa^lumbi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălumbīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>palumbes</etym>, <sense id="n33553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of wood-pigeons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 12, 36, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 8, 21, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palumbulus: <entryFree id="n33554" type="main" key="pa^lumbu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălumbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little wood-pigeon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little dove</hi>, as a term of endearment (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">teneo te meum palumbulum, meum passerem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 249, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl>, p. 213, 33.</sense></entryFree>
palumbus: <entryFree id="n33555" type="main" key="pa^lumbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălumbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. palumbes <sense id="n33555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
palus: <entryFree id="n33556" type="main" key="pa_lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pālus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n33556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pālum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 219, 18</bibl>) [for paglus (cf. <lbl>dim.</lbl> paxillus); root pag-; Sanscr. pācas, snare; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ph/gnumi</foreign>, fasten; Lat. pango; cf.: pignus, pax], <hi rend="ital">a stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pale.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33556.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: sudes, stipes): ut figam palum in parietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnati ad supplicium traditi, ad palum alligati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:5:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palis adjungere vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit> (7), 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:665" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 665</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palos et ridicas dolare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.—The Roman soldiers learned to fight by attacking a stake set in the ground, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, aut quis non vidit vulnera pali?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:246" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 246</bibl></cit>.—And, transf.: exerceamur ad palum: et, ne <cb n="PAMP" /> imparatos fortuna deprehendat, fiat nobis paupertas familiaris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 6</bibl>.—In the lang. of gladiators, palus primus or palusprimus (called also machaera Herculeana, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 8</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a gladiator's sword of wood</hi>, borne by the secutores, whence their leader was also called primus palus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 694.—Prov.: quasi palo pectus tundor, of one astonished, stunned,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33556.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33557" type="main" key="pa^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pălus</orth>, <itype>ūdis</itype> (<sense id="n33557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> pălŭs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 65</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but usually pălūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 107</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> paludum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 38, 2</bibl> Oud.; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely paludium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 7</bibl></cit> Drak.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 68, 68, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. Aug. 12, 2</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>= Gr. <foreign lang="greek">phlo/s</foreign>, mud; cf. Sanscr. palvala, pool; perh. -ud of the stem = <foreign lang="greek">u(/dwr</foreign>, water</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a swamp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pool</hi> (cf.: stagnum, lacus). </sense><sense id="n33557.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille paludes siccare voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludes emere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:27:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 27, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus erat non magna inter nostrum atque hostium exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter paludes exercitui aditus non est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cocyti tardāque palus inamabilis undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilisve diu palus aptaque remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">udae paludes intumuere aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagnata paludibus ument,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:269" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nebulosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:382" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, Palus Maeotis, = Lacus Maeotis, now <hi rend="ital">the Sea of Azof</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33557.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33557.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A reed</hi> that grows in marshes: <cit><quote lang="la">tomentum concisa palus Circense vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:160:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 160, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:32:2" default="NO">11, 32, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33557.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cymba) multam accepit rimosa paludem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 414</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
palusca: <entryFree id="n33558" type="main" key="palusca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">palusca</orth>, <itype>ficus</itype>, <sense id="n33558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fig</hi>, Cloat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
paluster: <entryFree id="n33559" type="main" key="pa^luster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păluster</orth>, <itype>tris, tre</itype> (<sense id="n33559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> palustris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 2</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. palus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">fenny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marshy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swampy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33559.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 175</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">calami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 706</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pă-lustrĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">swampy places</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:47:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 47, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33559.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux, i. e.,</quote> <trans><tr>a filthy</tr>, <tr>vicious life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:60" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pamisus: <entryFree id="n33560" type="main" key="Pa^mi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pămīsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/misos</foreign>. <sense id="n33560.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Messenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 7, § 15</bibl>; Mela, 2, 3, 9.—</sense><sense id="n33560.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pammacharius: <entryFree id="n33561" type="main" key="pamma^cha_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pammăchārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pammachum</etym>, <sense id="n33561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the victor in the pammachum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 36, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pammachum: <entryFree id="n33562" type="main" key="pammachum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pammachum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-chium</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pamma/xion</foreign>, <sense id="n33562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an athletic contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of wrestling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boxing with the naked fists</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and boxing with the cestus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (ludis) contendit pammachum (al. pammacho) quod nos pancratium vocamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 106</bibl>, n. 226.</sense></entryFree>
pammenes: <entryFree id="n33563" type="main" key="Pamme^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pammĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek rhetorician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instructor of Brutus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pammĕnia</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pammenes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pammenia illa mihi non placent,</quote> <trans><tr>those views of Pammenes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pamphagus: <entryFree id="n33564" type="main" key="Pampha^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pamphăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 210</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pamphilus: <entryFree id="n33565" type="main" key="Pamphi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pamphĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/mfilos</foreign>, <sense id="n33565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33565.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disciple of Plato</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom Epicurus heard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33565.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated painter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Amphipolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the instructor of Apelles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:123" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 40, § 123</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33565.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rhetorician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pamphylia: <entryFree id="n33566" type="main" key="Pamphy_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pamphȳlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pamfuli/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country on the sea-coast of Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Lycia and Cilicia</hi>, Mela, 1, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 41, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 26, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:77" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 77</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33566.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pam-phȳlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pamphylian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">teilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 129</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pamphȳlii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Pamphylians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 15, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pampinaceus: <entryFree id="n33567" type="main" key="pampi^na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pampĭnācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, i. q. pampineus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 5</bibl> dub.</entryFree>
pampinarius: <entryFree id="n33568" type="main" key="pampi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pampĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pampinus</etym>, <sense id="n33568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to tendrils</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has tendrils</hi>: palmitum duo genera sunt: alterum, quod, quia primo anno plerumque <cb n="PAN" /> frondem sine fructu affert, pampinarium vocant, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 24, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33568.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pampĭnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, i. q. pampinarium sarmentum, <hi rend="ital">a tendril-branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leaf-branch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:181" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 22, 35, § 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pampinatio: <entryFree id="n33569" type="main" key="pampi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pampĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pampino</etym>, <sense id="n33569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking off of superfluous tendrils and leaves of vines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lopping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trimming of vines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut frequenti pampinatione supervacua detrahantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:6:1:section=5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 6, 1, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:7:1" default="NO">4, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:28:1" default="NO">4, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:38" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 190</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pampinator: <entryFree id="n33570" type="main" key="pampi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pampĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who plucks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lops off the superfluous tendrils and leaves of vines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vine-trimmer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">industrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 27, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pampinatus: <entryFree id="n33571" type="main" key="pampi^na_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pampĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pampino.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33572" type="main" key="pampi^na_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pampĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pampinus</etym>, <sense id="n33572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having tendrils and leaves.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33572.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: lanceam argenteam pampinatam librarum triginta, Gallien. Ep. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17, 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33572.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">tendril-shaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tendril-like</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 82, § 225</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pampineus: <entryFree id="n33573" type="main" key="pampi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pampĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of tendrils</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vine-leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of tendrils</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctumnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastae,</quote> <trans><tr>wrapped round with vine-leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 804</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <trans><tr>decked with vine-branches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 26: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:93:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 93, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <trans><tr>the perfume of wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit> (3, 31), 30: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <trans><tr>of vine-leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:59" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pampino: <entryFree id="n33574" type="main" key="pampi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pampĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pluck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lop off the superfluous tendrils</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and leaves of vines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to trim vines.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33574.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampinare est ex sarmento coles qui nati sunt, de iis qui plurimum valent, primum ac secundum, nonnumquam etiam tertium relinquere, reliquos decerpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampinandi modus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 27, 67, § 254</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33574.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to trim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prune trees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salix non minus, quam vinea pampinatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:31:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 31, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:21" default="NO">5, 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:79" default="NO">11, 2, 79</bibl> saep.</sense></entryFree>
pampinosus: <entryFree id="n33575" type="main" key="pampi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pampĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of foliage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leafy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">branchy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pampinus: <entryFree id="n33576" type="main" key="pampi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pampĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> (in <sense id="n33576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumflua pampinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Stil. 366</bibl></cit>: opaca, id. Epith. Pall. et Celer. 5; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> p. 1747</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 7, 58</bibl>, acc. to whom Varro often used the word as a <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>) [root pamp-, pap-, to swell, v. pōpulus; cf. papula, pustule], <hi rend="ital">a tendril</hi> or <hi rend="ital">young shoot of a vine</hi> (cf. palmes). </sense><sense id="n33576.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex gemmis pampini pullulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampinos detergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 193</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33576.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A vine-leaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the foliage of a vine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">involvulus, quae in pampini folio intorta implicat se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva vestita pampinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male defendet pampinus uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus viridi tempora pampino Liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampini densitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33576.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a clasper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tendril of any climbing plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 35, 63, § 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:163" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 51, 74, § 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pan: <entryFree id="n33577" type="main" key="Pa_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pān</orth>, <itype>Pānŏs</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Pāna), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/n</foreign>, <sense id="n33577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the god of the woods and of shepherds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Mercury and Penelope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 224" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pan erat armenti custos, Pan numen equarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:277" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panos de more Lycaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 344</bibl></cit>. He was represented under the form of a goat; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, semicaper Pan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 515</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:327" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 327</bibl>. His mistress, Syrinx, was transformed, at her request, by the nymphs into a thicket of reeds, from which Pan made the shepherd's pipe (<foreign lang="greek">su/rigc</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 586</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 691</bibl>. He is also said to have fallen in love with Luna, and to have gained her favor by the present of a ram, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 391</bibl> Serv. In war he was regarded as the producer of sudden, groundless (panic) terrors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:46" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 46</bibl> sqq.—He was called at a later period the god of <hi rend="ital">All</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">to\ pa=n</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33577.1" n="II" level="1"> In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panes,</quote> <trans><tr>gods of the woods and fields resembling Pan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 638</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Panum, Mela, 3, 9, 6.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Panas, Col. poët. 10, 427. <pb n="1296" /> <cb n="PANC" /></sense></entryFree>
panaca: <entryFree id="n33578" type="main" key="pana^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">panăca</orth>, <sense id="n33578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of drinking-vessel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:100" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 100</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
panacea: <entryFree id="n33579" type="greek" key="pa^na^ce_a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pănăcēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pănăces</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pănax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pana/keia, panake/s, pa/nac</foreign>. <sense id="n33579.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An herb to which was ascribed the power of healing all diseases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all-heal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">panacea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catholicon;</hi> on the different kinds, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 11, § 30 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorifera panacea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panaces ipso nomine omnium morborum remedia promittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 11, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panax levi et subactā terrā rarissime disseritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33579.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> ligusticum silvestre: <cit><quote lang="la">ligusticum silvestre panacem aliqui vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 50, § 165</bibl></cit>.—Form panaces, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 16, 60, § 168</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33579.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinaca opopinax.—Form panax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 26, 57, § 127</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n33579.3" n="2" level="3"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănăcēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the four daughters of Æsculapius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33580" type="main" key="Pa^na^ce_a2" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănăcēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Crete</hi>, Mela, 2, 7.</sense></entryFree>
panacinus: <entryFree id="n33581" type="main" key="pa^na^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pănăcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>panacea</etym>, <sense id="n33581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of the panacea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clyster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:7:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 7, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panaenus: <entryFree id="n33582" type="main" key="Pa^naenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănaenus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous painter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of the sculptor Phidias</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:57" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 8, 34, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
