panaetius: <entryFree id="n33583" type="main" key="Pa^naeti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănaetĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*panai/tios</foreign>, <sense id="n33583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Stoic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Rhodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the instructor and friend of Scipio Africanus the Younger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:32:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 32, 79</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panaetolicus: <entryFree id="n33584" type="main" key="Pa^naeto_li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănaetōlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*panaitwliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the whole of Ætolia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Panœtolian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 32, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 32, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panaetolium: <entryFree id="n33585" type="main" key="Pa^naeto_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănaetōlĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*panaitw/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n33585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the council of the whole of Ætolia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a general assembly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">congress of the Ætolians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium Aetolorum quod Panaetolium vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 29, 1</bibl></cit>; Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 32, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33585.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very high mountain in Ætolia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Viena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 2, 3, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panaricium: <entryFree id="n33586" type="main" key="pa^na_rici^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pănāricĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>corrupted from paronychium</etym>, <sense id="n33586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease of the finger-nails</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panariolum: <entryFree id="n33587" type="main" key="pa_na_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānārĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>panarium</etym>, <sense id="n33587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bread-basket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:49:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 49, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panarium: <entryFree id="n33588" type="main" key="pa_na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānārĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pann-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>panis</etym>, <sense id="n33588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bread-basket</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc panarium, ubi id (sc. panem) servabant, sicut granarium, ubi granum frumenti condebant, unde id dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=105" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 105</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:31" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panarius: <entryFree id="n33589" type="gloss" key="pa_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bread-seller</hi>: panarius, <foreign lang="greek">a)rtopw/lhs</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
panathenaicon: <entryFree id="n33590" type="greek" key="pa^na^the_na_i^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pănăthēnāĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">panaqhnai+ko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n33590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ointment made in Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panathenaicus: <entryFree id="n33591" type="main" key="Pa^na^the_na_i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănăthēnāĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*panaqhnaiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Panathenœa</hi> (a popular festival of the Athenians); hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33591.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănăthēnāĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. solemnia), <hi rend="ital">the Panathenœa</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33591.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănăthēnā-ĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. liber), <hi rend="ital">a holiday oration of Isocrates pronounced at the Panathenœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 12, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 5, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panax: <entryFree id="n33592" type="main" key="pa^nax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pănax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, v. panacea.</entryFree>
pancarpineus: <entryFree id="n33593" type="greek" key="pancarpi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pancarpĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pancarpus</etym>, <sense id="n33593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">composed of all kinds of fruits</hi>: cibus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 264, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pancarpius: <entryFree id="n33594" type="greek" key="pancarpi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pancarpĭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pancarpus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pagka/rpios</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">pa/gkarpos</foreign>, <sense id="n33594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">composed of all kinds of fruits.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33594.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pancarpiae dicuntur coronae ex vario genere florum factae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Jesum cognominant Soterem et Christum ... Quam propius fuit de Atticis historiis pancarpiam vocari (alluding to the olive-branch, ornamented with all sorts of fruits, which was carried about by boys in Athens on a certain festival),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Val. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33594.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of all sorts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomine pancarpi, qui in ludicris muneribus edi solet, propter omnium generum, quae inerant, bestias, exagitatis Arcam Noe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:adv. Secund. 23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> adv. Secund. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panchaeus: <entryFree id="n33595" type="main" key="Panchaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Panchaeus</orth>, v. Panchaia, A.</entryFree>
panchaia: <entryFree id="n33596" type="main" key="Pancha_i^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Panchāĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pagxai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n33596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous island in the Erythrœan Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">east of Arabia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich in precious stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incense</hi>, <cb n="PAND" /> <hi rend="ital">myrrh</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">totaque turiferis Panchaia pinguis arenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(phoenicem) deferre nidum prope Panchaiam in Solis urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:119" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 119</bibl>; Claud. III. Cons. Honor. f.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33596.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Panchaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Panchœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 417</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 379</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 478</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Panchaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Panchaia</hi>, Mela, 3, 8.—</sense><sense id="n33596.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Panchāĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Panchœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">resinulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 233</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33596.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Panchāĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Panchœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus (al. Panchaea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 309</bibl></cit>: cinnama, Claud. Nupt. Honor. et Mar. 94.</sense></entryFree>
panchrestarius: <entryFree id="n33597" type="main" key="panchresta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">panchrestārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>panchrestus</etym>, <sense id="n33597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a confectioner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coquos, panchrestarios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panchrestus: <entryFree id="n33598" type="greek" key="panchrestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">panchrestus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">panchristus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/gxrhstos</foreign>, <sense id="n33598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good</hi> or <hi rend="ital">useful for every thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 20, 38, § 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:136" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 7, 71, § 136</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33598.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, ironically: cum omnes ejus comites iste sibi suo illo panchresto medicamento amicos reddidisset, <hi rend="ital">by his sovereign remedy</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">money</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:65:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 65, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panchromos: <entryFree id="n33599" type="greek" key="panchro_mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">panchrōmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/gxrwmos</foreign> (all-colored), <sense id="n33599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> verbenaca, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panchrus: <entryFree id="n33600" type="greek" key="panchrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">panchrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/gxrous</foreign> (of all colors), <sense id="n33600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a variegated precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panchrysos: <entryFree id="n33601" type="greek" key="Panchry_sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Panchrȳsos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/gxrusos</foreign>, <sense id="n33601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all golden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Berenice urbs, quae Panchrysos cognominata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 170</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pancratias: <entryFree id="n33602" type="main" key="pancra^ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pancrătĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for pancratiastes, <sense id="n33602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pancratiast</hi>, v. l. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:27:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 27, 3</bibl> (al. pancratiastae).</sense></entryFree>
pancratiastes: <entryFree id="n33603" type="greek" key="pancra^ti^astes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pancrătĭastes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pagkratiasth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a combatant in the</hi> pancratium, <hi rend="ital">a pancratiast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diagoras tres filios adulescentes habuit, unum pugilem, alterum pancratiasten, tertium luctatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19</bibl>, §§ 57, 59; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pancratice: <entryFree id="n33604" type="hapax" key="pancra^ti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pancrătĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n33604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after the manner of the pancratiasts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pancratice atque athletice valere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>heartily</tr>, <tr>finely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pancratium: <entryFree id="n33605" type="greek" key="pancra^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pancrătĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tion</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pagkra/tion</foreign>. <sense id="n33605.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A complete combat; a gymnastic contest which included both wrestling and boxing;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et patitur duro volnera pancratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:13:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Autolycos pancratio victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 139</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 100</bibl>, n. 226.—</sense><sense id="n33605.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The herb succory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 30, § 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33605.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> scilla pusilla, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 92, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pancratius: <entryFree id="n33606" type="greek" key="pancra^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pancrătĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pagkra/tios</foreign>, <sense id="n33606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pancratian</hi>: metrum pancratium, <hi rend="ital">a trochaic metre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of a</hi> monometer hypercatalectus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centimetr. p. 1819</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
panda: <entryFree id="n33607" type="main" key="Panda1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Panda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. pando</etym>, <sense id="n33607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman goddess;</hi> acc. to Aelius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 44, 7</bibl>, Ceres; Varro, however, distinguishes her from Ceres, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod T. Tatio, Capitolinum ut capiat collum, viam pandere atque aperire permissum est, dea Panda est appellata vel Pantica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 128</bibl></cit>: Panda, <foreign lang="greek">ei)rh/nhs qeo/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33608" type="main" key="Panda2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Panda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian river</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pandae: <entryFree id="n33609" type="main" key="Pandae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens sola Indorum regnata feminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 76</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Pandœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pandana: <entryFree id="n33610" type="main" key="Panda_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. pando</etym>, <sense id="n33610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the oldest gates of Rome</hi>, so called because it always stood open: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnia porta, quam Junius scribit, ibi, quam nunc vocant Pandanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 42</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pandana porta dicta est Romae, quod semper pateret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pandarus: <entryFree id="n33611" type="main" key="Panda^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n33611.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A leader of the Lycians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auxiliary of the Trojans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 496</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33611.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Alcanor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companion of Æneas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Turnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:672 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 672 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 396</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pandataria: <entryFree id="n33612" type="main" key="Panda_ta_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandātārĭa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ērĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ōrĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Tyrrhenian Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a place of exile under the emperors</hi>, now the island of <hi rend="ital">Vandolina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:5:7" default="NO">3, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 11, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 644</bibl>; Mela, 2, 7.</sense></entryFree>
pandatio: <entryFree id="n33613" type="hapax" key="panda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. pando</etym>, <sense id="n33613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warping</hi> of wood, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>. <cb n="PAND" /></sense></entryFree>
pandecter: <entryFree id="n33614" type="greek" key="pandecter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandecter</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pandekth/r</foreign> (allcontaining), <sense id="n33614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of the fourth book of the work of Apicius.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pandectes: <entryFree id="n33615" type="greek" key="pandectes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandectes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pande/kths</foreign>, <sense id="n33615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a book that contains every thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a complete repertory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an encyclopedia</hi>, a title frequently given to books; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 9, 4</bibl>; Plin. H. N. praef., § 24. </sense><sense id="n33615.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">novissime Tiro in Pandecte non recte dici ait,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 186</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n33615.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pan-dectae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of the collection of Roman laws made by order of Justinian from the writings of Roman jurists; the Pandects</hi>, Just. Ep. ad Sen. § 1.</sense></entryFree>
pandemus: <entryFree id="n33616" type="greek" key="pande_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/ndhmos</foreign>, <sense id="n33616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">affecting all the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lues,</quote> <trans><tr>an epidemic</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pandicularis: <entryFree id="n33617" type="gloss" key="pandi^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandĭcŭlāris</orth> <itype>dicebatur dies idem et communicarius, in quo omnibus diis communiter sacrificabatur</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
pandiculor: <entryFree id="n33618" type="main" key="pandi^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandĭcŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>2. pando</etym>, <sense id="n33618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pandiculans oscitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pandiculari dicuntur, qui toto corpore oscitantes extenduntur, eo quod pandi fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pandion: <entryFree id="n33619" type="main" key="Pandi_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandīon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pandi/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n33619.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Progne and Philomela</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 48" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 426</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">676</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pandionis populus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Athenians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pandione nata,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Progne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 634</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">the nightingale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cecropiae Pandionis arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:26:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33619.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandīŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pandionian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pandioniae Athenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pandionia Orithyia,</quote> <trans><tr>the sister of Pandion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Pandioniae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Athenian state</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Honor. 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <trans><tr>the citadel of Athens</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:720" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <trans><tr>the nightingale and the swallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Octav. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Octav. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavea,</quote> <trans><tr>the Athenian theatre</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33619.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Jupiter and Luna</hi>, Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
pando: <entryFree id="n33620" type="main" key="pando1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pando</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for spando; root spa-; Sanscr. spha-, spread, grow; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">spa/w</foreign>; cf. spatium</etym>. <sense id="n33620.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curve</hi> any thing (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flecto, curvo): pandant enim posteriora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:122" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus leviter pandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 100</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33620.1" n="(b)" level="5"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to bend itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in inferiora pandantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 81, § 223</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:189" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 39, 74, § 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:219" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 40, 79, § 219</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes sarcinā pandatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmiora juga sunt alliganda, ut rigorem habeant nec pandentur onere fructuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n33620.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus et fraxinus celeriter pandant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33621" type="main" key="pando2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pando</orth> <itype>pandi</itype> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 891</bibl> P.), passum, and less freq. pansum (v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 567 sq.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n33621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend; to unfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expand</hi> [from the root pat of pateo, cf. <foreign lang="greek">peta/nnumi</foreign>, q. v.] (syn.: explano, explico, extendo). </sense><sense id="n33621.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pandere palmas Ante deum delubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1200</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad solem pennas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 9, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telas in parietibus latissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 87</bibl></cit>: aciem, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deploy</hi>, = explicare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupem ferro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to split</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utere velis, Totos pande sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:150" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33621.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa panditur planities,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum se cornua latius pandunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa sese pandit in calices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi mare coepit in latitudinem pandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si panditur ultra (gremium),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is not yet full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:327" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 327</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33621.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in econom. lang., <hi rend="ital">to spread out to dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry</hi> fruits: <cit><quote lang="la">ficos pandere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas in sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 39, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33621.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33621.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to open</hi> any thing by extending it (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: patefacio, aperio, recludo): pandite atque aperite propere januam hanc Orci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pandite, sulti', genas (i. e. palpebras), Enn. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. genas, p. 94 Müll. (Ann. v. 521 Vahl.): dividimus muros et moenia pandimus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cerberus) tria guttura pandens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 525</bibl></cit>: agros pingues, <hi rend="ital">to lay open</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to plough up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">till</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1248</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piceae tantum taxique nocentes Interdum aut hederae pandunt vestigia nigrae,</quote> <trans><tr>disclose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torridam incendio rupem ferro pandunt,</quote> <trans><tr>lay open</tr>, <tr>split</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pandite nunc Helicona, deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 641</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33621.6" n="2" level="3"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to open itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to open</hi>: panduntur inter ordines<pb n="1297" /> <cb n="PAND" />  viae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum caudā omnis jam panditur Hydra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>displays itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=449" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 449</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33621.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33621.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend;</hi> and with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extend itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tempora se veris florentia pandunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa divina (bona) longe lateque se pandunt caelumque contingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerebam utrum panderem vela orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbriferos ubi pandit Tabrica saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:194" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 194</bibl></cit>. —Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aquilone pandetur malum super omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; see also under <pos>P. a.</pos> B.—</sense><sense id="n33621.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam alicui ad dominationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33621.10" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to unfold</hi> in speaking, <hi rend="ital">to make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">omnem rerum naturam dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primordia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res altā terrā et caligine mersas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 267</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 252</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 479</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hesiodus agricolis praecepta pandere orsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 14:1:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 14, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33621.11" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pansus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outspread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outstretched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi> (rare and mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">manibus et pedibus pansis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppliciter pansis ad numina palmis, Germ. Arat. 68: sago porrectius panso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pansis in altum bracchiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 170</bibl></cit>: panso currere carbaso, id. adv. Symm. praef. 1, 48.—</sense><sense id="n33621.12" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">passus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo, quod est pando passum veteres dixerunt, non pansum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 15, 1</bibl></cit>), <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">outspread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outstretched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33621.13" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">velo passo pervenire,</quote> <trans><tr>under full sail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">velis passis pervehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passis late palmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passis manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 17, 17, § 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:15:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 15, 3</bibl>: crinis passus, and more freq. in <number>plur.</number>, crines passi, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishevelled hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus passus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1</bibl>. 51; 7, 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 480</bibl> et saep.—Hence, verba passa, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relaxed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">prose</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, 15, p. 352, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33621.14" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33621.15" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Spread out</hi> to dry (v. supra, I. 2.); hence, <hi rend="ital">dried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>raisins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 4</bibl> Mai; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 6, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">acini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">racemi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva passa pendilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac passum,</quote> <trans><tr>boiled milk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 274</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33621.16" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: rugosi passique senes, <hi rend="ital">dried up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withered</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 12, 5</bibl> (Sat. 19, 11).— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">passum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vinum), <hi rend="ital">wine made from dried grapes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raisin-wine</hi>: passum nominabant, si in vindemiā uvam diutius coctam legerent, eamque passi essent in sole aduri, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 551, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">passo psythia utilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:271" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 271</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 19, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">passum quo ex sicciore uva est, eo valentius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33621.17" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: verba passa, <hi rend="ital">prose</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 352, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pandora: <entryFree id="n33622" type="main" key="Pando_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n33622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Pandoras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 19</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">*pandw/ra</foreign>, gifted by all</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the first woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made by Vulcan at Jupiter's command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and presented with gifts by all the gods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Epimetheus and mother of Pyrrha</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 142" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 142</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pandora Hesiodi, of a work executed by several hands,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pandorius: <entryFree id="n33623" type="main" key="pando_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandōrĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pandūrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. pandura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 20, 8</bibl>.</entryFree>
pandosia: <entryFree id="n33624" type="main" key="Pando_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandōsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pandwsi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n33624.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Acheron</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kastri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33624.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of the Bruttians</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Mendocino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pandrosos: <entryFree id="n33625" type="main" key="Pandro^sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandrŏsos</orth>, i. <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/ndrosos</foreign>, <sense id="n33625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Cecrops and sister of Aglauros and Herse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 559</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 738</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pandura: <entryFree id="n33626" type="greek" key="pandu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pandūrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pandou=ra</foreign>, <sense id="n33626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a musical instrument of three strings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invented by Pan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hircipedem (i. e. Pana) pandura ... Faunum tibia decuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 906</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, § 924</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pandurizo: <entryFree id="n33627" type="main" key="pandu_rizo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandūrizo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>pandura</etym>, <sense id="n33627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play the</hi> pandura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pandus: <entryFree id="n33628" type="main" key="pandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. pando</etym>, <sense id="n33628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curved</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn.: curvus, uncus): carina, Enn. ap. Vet. Schol. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 558</bibl> (Ann. v. 560 Vahl.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> G 2, 445</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami, Ov M. 14, 660: juga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am 1, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencae pandis cornibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cb n="PANG" /> rostrum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 713</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asellus,</quote> <trans><tr>crook-backed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:A. 1:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pandā urceus ansā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:106:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 106, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:277" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 277</bibl>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem nigrum et macrum et pandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus et pinus habentes umoris abundantiam in operibus solent esse pandae,</quote> <trans><tr>to warp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33628.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pandus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinius Pandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pane: <entryFree id="n33629" type="main" key="pa_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. panis.</entryFree>
panegyricus: <entryFree id="n33630" type="greek" key="pa^ne_gy^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pănēgyrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">panhguriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a public assembly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">festival;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pănēgy-rĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival oration of Isocrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which he eulogized the Athenians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 11, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33630.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">praising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laudatory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eulogistic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli,</quote> <trans><tr>panegyrics</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pănēgyrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a eulogy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">panegyric</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam malos panegyricis mendacibus adulantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 15, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panegyrista: <entryFree id="n33631" type="greek" key="pa^ne_gy^rista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pănēgyrista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">panhguristh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a eulogist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">panegyrist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paneros: <entryFree id="n33632" type="greek" key="pa^ne^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pănĕros</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pănĕrastos</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pane/rws</foreign>, <sense id="n33632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supposed to have the property of making fruitful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 178</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33632.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănĕros</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">a slavename</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Fr. Arv. p. 631.</sense></entryFree>
pangaeus: <entryFree id="n33633" type="main" key="Pangaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pangaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pangaea</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/ggaion o)/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n33633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Philippi</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pilaf Tepeh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mons Pangaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flerunt Rhodopeiae arces Altaque Pangaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 462</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 679</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33633.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pangaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pangœan;</hi> also for <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi> (late <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nemora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:73" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:631" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:575" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 575</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pango: <entryFree id="n33634" type="main" key="pango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pango</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, and pēgi or pĕpĭgi, pactum</itype> (v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 474 sq.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root pac-; Sanscr. pāca, band, fetter; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ph/gnumi</foreign>, fix; <foreign lang="greek">pa/xnh</foreign>, frost; <foreign lang="greek">pa/ssalos</foreign>, peg, etc.; cf.: pagus, pagina, paciscor; old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">paco</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pago</orth>; cf.: rem ubipacunt, XII.Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 20</bibl>; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 894</bibl> P.</etym>, <sense id="n33634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix; to drive in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink in</hi> (syn.: figo, configo). </sense><sense id="n33634.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pangere, figere; <cit><quote lang="la">unde plantae pangi dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=213" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 213</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">clavum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>; v. clavus: tonsillam pegi laevo in litore, Pac. ap. Fest. s. v tonsilla, p. 356 Müll.; Col. poët. 10, 252; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 9, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33634.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33634.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plant</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ramulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicena millia malleolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: lactucam <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taleam olearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, transf.: filios,</quote> <trans><tr>to beget children</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n33634.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse seram vites pangamque ex ordine colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 15: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiaria malleolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33634.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33634.6" n="A" level="2"> Versus carmina or facta (like componere), <hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">write</hi>, <hi rend="ital">record</hi>: hic vostrum panxit maxuma facta patrum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl> (Epigr. v. 2 Vahl. p. 162; <cit><quote lang="la">but the verse: horrida Romuleum certamina pango duellum, is spurious): carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus de rerum naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid Sophocleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">a)ne/kdota</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pangendi facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pangendo nihil fieri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33634.7" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prima per artem temptamenta tui pepigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33634.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi> (class., but only in the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> forms; for the <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> pacisci was used; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:10 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 10 sq.</bibl>: paciscor facit et pepigi et pactus sum, Serv. ad. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 144</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">paciscor, stipulor, despondeo): ducentis Philippis rem pepigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactam rem habeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terminos, quos Socrates pepigerit (al. pegerit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 16, 37</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis pepigerit ne illo (medicamento) usquam postea uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem nobiscum pepigistis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducias pepigisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fuit armillas tanti pepigisse Sabinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resumere libertatem occultis insidiis pepigerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui pretium pepigerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 42</bibl></cit>. —Freq. of a marriage contract, <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pledge</hi>, etc.: habeon' pactam (Sororem)?<cb n="PANI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pepigere viri, pepigerunt ante parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te peto quam lecto pepigit Venus aurea nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 35</bibl></cit>: haec mihi se pepigit; <cit><quote lang="la">pater hanc tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:20:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pangonius: <entryFree id="n33635" type="greek" key="pango_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pangōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pangōnus</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">paggw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n33635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panhormus: <entryFree id="n33636" type="main" key="Pa^nhormus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănhormus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănhormĭtā-nus</orth>, v. Panormus.</entryFree>
panicellus: <entryFree id="n33637" type="main" key="pa_ni^cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>panis</etym>, <sense id="n33637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little loaf</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paniceus: <entryFree id="n33638" type="main" key="pa_ni^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of bread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>huge loaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 257</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pānĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Breadville</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est Paniceis, milites panicei (a comic expression),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panicium: <entryFree id="n33639" type="main" key="pa_ni^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n33639.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing baked</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cakes</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33639.1" n="II" level="1"> = panicum, <hi rend="ital">Italian panic-grass</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 3</bibl> ad Sev.; Edict. Diocl. p. 27; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panicoctarius: <entryFree id="n33640" type="main" key="pa_ni^cocta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcoctārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paniscoquo</etym>, <sense id="n33640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bread-making</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrysol. Serm. 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panicula: <entryFree id="n33641" type="main" key="pa_ni^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcŭla</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pānŭcŭla</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl> Müll.; and contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">pānŭcla</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 22</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>panus</etym>, <sense id="n33641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tuft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a panicle</hi> on plants. </sense><sense id="n33641.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: tu legiones difflavisti spiritu, quasi ventus folia aut paniculum tectorium, <hi rend="ital">a tuft of thatch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of reeds used for thatching</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecula rosa convolutis foliorum paniculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panicum a paniculis dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33641.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 82" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paniculus: <entryFree id="n33642" type="main" key="pa_ni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. panicula.</entryFree>
panicum: <entryFree id="n33643" type="main" key="pa_ni^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Italian panic-grass</hi>: panicum Italicum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panifex: <entryFree id="n33644" type="main" key="pa_ni^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭfex</orth>, <itype>fĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>panis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n33644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breadmaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 2</bibl>; cf.: panifex, <foreign lang="greek">a)rtopoio/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
panifica: <entryFree id="n33645" type="main" key="pa_ni^fi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭfĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female baker; plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 8, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panificium: <entryFree id="n33646" type="main" key="pa_ni^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānĭfĭcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pānĕf-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the making of bread.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33646.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pane et faciendo panificium coeptum dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=105" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 105</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n33646.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any thing baked</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cakes</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbenas coronasque et panificia libertus obtulisse ei visus est,</quote> <trans><tr>offering-cakes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panion: <entryFree id="n33647" type="main" key="pa_ni_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānīon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> satyrion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
panionius: <entryFree id="n33648" type="main" key="Pa^ni^o_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănĭōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*paniw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n33648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to all Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred to all Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Panionian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio omnibus Ionibus sacra et ideo Panionia appellata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33648.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pănĭōnĭum</orth>, ii. <gen>n.</gen>, i. q. regio Panionia: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi est Panionium, sacra regio, et ob id eo nomine appellata, quod eam communiter Iones colunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
panis: <entryFree id="n33649" type="main" key="pa_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pānis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n33649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pāne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 218, 12</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 69</bibl> and 114 P.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: non item apud vos est positum hoc pane et hic panis? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>, panium, acc. to Caes. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 69</bibl> and 114 P.; panuin, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 771</bibl> P.) [from the root pa, to feed; whence also <foreign lang="greek">pa/omai</foreign>, pabulum, and pasco], <hi rend="ital">bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a loaf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33649.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc farinam aquā sparsit et assiduā tractatione perdomuit finxitque panem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pistore panem petimus, vinum ex oenopolio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt ventris stabilimenta: pane et arsā bubulā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu rogas, Purpureum panem an puniceum soleam ego esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis rubidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: cibarius panis, <hi rend="ital">coarse bread</hi> (v. cibarius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundus,</quote> <trans><tr>black bread</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1,
